* Lead and execute an assigned business focus area through planning and detailed follow through

* Perform Leader on Duty supervisor responsibilities by driving results and responding to customer concerns timely and with an appropriate resolution

* Utilize customer feedback to identify areas of opportunity to implement actions to drive results

* Build customer loyalty through Company sponsored programs, including credit

* Offer consistent, in the moment feedback to store team and raise performance concerns to Store Manager

* Recognize exceptional performance through positive reinforcement and appreciation

* Support store team with Asset Protection through a consistent level of customer service, safety awareness, and operational controls

**Qualities we’d love in a candidate:**

* A positive and solutions-oriented mindset

* Effective and professional verbal and written communication skills

* The ability to manage multiple tasks at once

* Proficient computer and technology skills (Outlook, Excel, Web navigation, etc.)

* A variety of skills and experiences

* A high school diploma or GED

  

**You can:**

* Lift 40 pounds as needed, with frequent bending, stooping, reaching, pushing, and pulling

* Stand or walk for extended periods of time; climb up and down a ladder

* Provide availability that may include days, nights, weekends, and holidays as scheduled

**Carter’s for all:**

Carter's is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. (Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran).

**Additional information:**

Applications will be accepted until at least 7 days after the posting date.

Carter's does not use AI to make any decision in our hiring process.

NOTE: This job description is not all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description. Carter’s may reasonably alter your duties, responsibilities, job title, and location.

* Source: Circana/ Consumer Tracking service, U.S. dollar share, 12 months ending September 2023.

*Carters is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.*

jobs.title: Advisory Solution Consultant - State and Local
jobs.description:
**Company Description**

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**

As a member of our Solution Consulting team, you will have a major impact on our future success by supporting the Core Business Services with a focus on Employee Workflows on our Public Sector, State and Local team. You will guide revenue for one of our products with the support and partnership of Sales, Product Management, and the executive team. This is a hands-on technical consultant who can go wide and deep on solution delivery and solution positioning during sales cycles.

**What you get to do in this role:**

The Solution Consultant is a technical consultant with the advanced ability to develop, position and provide product-specific solutions during sales cycles while achieving quarterly and annual sales goals for an assigned territory.

* Support product sales as a technical and domain expert of a client-facing sales team
* Lead discovery workshops to determine customers' challenges and give product demonstrations to align our solution with customer needs
* Answer product feature and technical questions from customers, channel partners and ServiceNow colleagues
* Provide feedback to product management about product enhancements that can address customer needs and provide additional value
* Share and learn best practices and re-usable assets with other Solution Consultants to enhance the quality and efficiency of the team
* Stay current on competitive analysis and market differentiation
* Support marketing events including executive briefings, conferences, user groups, and trade shows

  
**Qualifications**

**To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 7+ years of pre-sales solution consulting or sales engineering experience
* Proficiency with the ServiceNow platform or technical expertise with cloud software solutions
* Experience working collaboratively with product management, product marketing, partners, and professional services
* Territory management skills, including pipeline building and working with Sales counterpart to guide execution excellence
* Travel, as necessary

  
**Additional Information**

**Work Personas**

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work. Learn more here.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

From Fortune. ©2024 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

jobs.description:
**Company Description**

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**

ServiceNow, a leader in Insurance solutions, is seeking an Advisory Solution Consultant (Core) to focus on Enterprise Insurance customers. This critical role involves providing consultative, pre-sales support to our customers.

What you get to do in this role: As a Solution Consultant, you'll be a trusted technical advisor, creating and delivering tailored solutions to our valued Enterprise Insurance customers. It's an exciting opportunity to help meet our quarterly and annual sales goals together in your territory. In this role, you will get to:

1. Identify, qualify, and move opportunities through the various stages of the sales cycle and deliver impactful solutions to our customers

2. Demonstrate the technical and business value of ServiceNow solutions to clients.

3. Work in a matrixed environment and leverage these resources effectively to provide solutions to our customers.

4. Leverage your knowledge of the Insurance Industry and demonstrate how the ServiceNow platform aligns to help our customers solve their most complex business problems.

This role requires a strategic approach to planning and executing against planned objectives while representing the entire portfolio of ServiceNow products. A successful candidate will be able to work in a matrixed environment, building relationships within IT and across various lines of business, focusing on delivering measurable results and driving the growth of ServiceNow's portfolio of solutions.

 **Qualifications**

**To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 7+ years of pre-sales solution consulting or sales engineering experience
* Demonstrated Financial Services Experience, preferably in Insurance experience

* Experience working collaboratively with product management, product marketing, partners, and professional services

jobs.title: Part-Time Pudding Operations & Sales Manager
jobs.description:
Position Overview

We are seeking a dynamic **Part-Time Pudding Operations & Sales Manager** to join Hey Puddin, LLC. This role offers an exciting opportunity to combine hands-on operations, outside sales, and business development in a creative food environment.

The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership and sales skills, a passion for customer engagement, and the ability to manage both daily production and growth initiatives. This position is perfect for someone looking to develop their management and sales expertise while actively contributing to marketing, wholesale expansion, and direct sales operations for a growing dessert brand.

Key Duties & ResponsibilitiesOperations & Production

* Lead and oversee daily pudding production operations, ensuring quality, consistency, and food safety standards are met
* Prepare pudding and manage production schedules
* Maintain inventory levels, ingredient sourcing, and supply ordering
* Maintain accurate operational records, schedules, and documentation
* Coordinate kitchen usage and production planning
* Coordinate annual inspections and compliance requirements with the State of Wisconsin Health Department

Sales, Business Development & Account Management

* Drive outside sales efforts by researching, establishing, and nurturing B2B relationships with restaurants, retailers, distributors, and event partners
* Manage key wholesale and recurring accounts through effective account management strategies to ensure satisfaction and retention
* Conduct business development activities to expand market reach and identify new sales opportunities
* Negotiate terms and agreements with clients, demonstrating strong negotiation skills (final contract approval by owner)
* Provide excellent customer service by responding to client inquiries, resolving issues, and maintaining professional relationships

Marketing, Technology & Data

* Develop and assist with marketing strategies to promote pudding products across social media, events, and online platforms
* Manage social media accounts and content schedules
* Support promotional campaigns, seasonal launches, and special offerings
* Utilize Square or similar tools to track sales activities, manage accounts, analyze data, and optimize sales performance
* Analyze sales metrics, market data, and customer trends to support strategic planning and growth decisions

Events, Logistics & Team Leadership

* Research and coordinate vending opportunities, festivals, and markets throughout Wisconsin
* Build and manage an annual vending and events calendar
* Drive the company van for deliveries, vending events, and wholesale fulfillment (once acquired)
* Coordinate and manage part-time staff or contractors as hired
* Provide basic training, task delegation, and leadership support
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders on product launches and operational improvements

Requirements & Qualifications

* Proven experience in outside sales, B2B sales, account management, or business development, preferably in food, beverage, or consumer goods
* Strong management and leadership skills with the ability to lead projects and coordinate multiple responsibilities
* Demonstrated success in negotiation, relationship-building, and customer retention
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret sales data and market trends
* Familiarity with Squareor similar platforms is highly desirable
* Excellent communication and customer service skills
* Highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented
* Ability to manage confidential business information (NDA required)
* Valid driver’s license and clean driving record

Preferred (Not Required)

* Prior experience in marketing, social media management, or technology-enabled sales
* Experience working in startups, small businesses, or owner-operated companies
* Familiarity with Wisconsin food safety regulations and inspections
* Passion for food entrepreneurship and brand-building

**Confidentiality Notice:** This role requires signing a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) and responsible handling of sensitive business, financial, and customer information.

This role offers an engaging environment where your sales expertise and operational leadership can thrive while contributing to a growing brand. We value innovative thinkers who are eager to make an impact through strategic business development and exceptional customer engagement.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Oak Creek, WI

jobs.title: Senior Public Relations Account Manager (Contract, Part-Time, Remote)
jobs.description:
**ABOUT UPLVL Agency:**

UPLVL Agency is a boutique public relations firm working with founder-led, service-based companies in health, wellness, lifestyle, business, and finance. Our clients are credentialed experts and CEOs who want meaningful visibility in credible media — from national television to top-tier podcasts and respected digital and print publications.

Founded by Kayley Hamilton, a two-time Emmy Award–winning journalist and former entertainment news reporter, UPLVL operates with newsroom standards: strong judgment, fast execution, clear communication, and accountability for results. We build an intentional roster of high-caliber clients and are adding a small number of experienced professionals as we grow.

**The Role:**

* This is a senior individual-contributor role with full account ownership.
* You will manage 2–5 client campaigns end-to-end, including strategy, pitch development, media outreach and follow-up, journalist and producer relationships, interview coordination, client communication, and delivery of coverage. Each account requires approximately 5–8 hours per week, and you will be responsible for keeping campaigns moving.
* You will collaborate with leadership on positioning and big-picture direction, but you are expected to operate independently day to day as someone who is skilled in running successful PR campaigns.
* This is a part-time, contract position to start, with the potential to grow into a larger role as the agency scales.

**What You’ll Be Responsible For:**

* Leading onboarding conversations and extracting what matters for media positioning
* Building six-month PR strategies that balance timely opportunities with longer-lead placements
* Developing relevant, news-aware angles that serve both the client and the outlet
* Pitching consistently to podcasts, digital and print publications, and broadcast
* Monitor the news, journalist queries, what’s trending, and newsjack our clients into the news cycle.
* Using and expanding your own media relationships, not relying only on databases
* Managing outreach, follow-ups, interviews, and coverage tracking through our systems
* Preparing clients for interviews with clear framing and expectations
* We appreciate candidates who have a keen eye for detail. To demonstrate your attention to detail, please let us know the name of your favorite podcast when emailing your resume to kayley@uplvlagency.com.
* Preparing monthly progress reports for each client campaign and presenting them to clients and their team via video call
* Keeping campaigns organized, proactive, and moving forward

This role requires both strong media instincts and strong client leadership.

**Who This Role Is For:**

* You have 4–6+ years of experience in PR agency environments (or in a newsroom), with direct responsibility for pitching, sourcing, and campaign execution
* You have secured earned media across top tier podcasts, digital/print, and broadcast
* You understand how the news cycle works and know when to move quickly
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills across a range of platforms (Slack, voice note, email, virtual client or team meetings, virtual presentations).
* You have strong creative writing skills in developing pitches, bios, PR strategies, angles, etc.
* You are comfortable being the primary point of contact for clients
* You have strong professional presentation skills
* You are organized, responsive, and consistent in follow-through
* You enjoy working with founder-led, expert-driven brands
* Familiarity with these softwares a plus: Propel My PR, ClickUp, Slack, Qwoted, Google Workspace, ChatGPT, Canva.
* Daily use and prompting knowledge of ChatGPT or other AI — a big plus.

**How We Work:**

UPLVL exists to help purpose-driven founders and experts reach the people who need them through credible, earned media. We care about mission, and we care about execution.

We expect our team to use good judgment, communicate directly, and take responsibility for results. We value kindness, positivity, optimism, growth and high standards. You will be trusted to do your work well and supported when you need perspective or collaboration.

This is a part-time contracted, fully remote position with flexible hours and the opportunity to become a full-time position. You will collaborate closely with our female-led team, Director of Client Relations Bryn Fallon and our CEO Kayley Hamilton who is a 2x Emmy Award-winning producer and former Hollywood reporter. We maintain an exceptional company culture. Our ethos is kindness, positivity, optimism, growth mindset, open-mindedness, discipline, determination and elite results. We hold Monday morning team connection calls including a group meditation.

*UPLVL Agency is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. Successful applicants undergo a standard background check and demonstrate eligibility to work in the United States.*

**\*\*\*HOW TO APPLY\*\*\***

**Please email your resume, LinkedIn profile link, a short list of recent and relevant media coverage you have secured (publications, podcasts, TV), and why you’re a good fit for this position to kayley@uplvlagency.com.**

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Sales Manager (Part Time) - 24H210
jobs.description:
Sales Manager (Part Time) - 24H210

### **If you are a CURRENT Carter’s employee, do not apply via this external application. Search ”Browse Jobs” in Workday to apply internally.**

**Love what you do. Carter’s Careers.**

As a Part Time Sales Manager, you will be the first face of the brand for growing families. You’ll congratulate new parents and grandparents, the first to introduce our new baby essentials, and the first to help prep for the first day of school, and all the big and little moments in their parenting journey. We’re looking for a leader who fosters a welcoming and inclusive environment, values and optimizes skills and talents, and continually educates themselves and their team on product styles, features, and benefits.

**What we love about Carter’s:**

Carter’s Inc. is the largest North American apparel retailer exclusively for babies and young children, encompassing Carter’s, OshKosh B’gosh, Skip\*Hop, and Little Planet brands. Carter’s is the #1 most-purchased children’s clothing brand.\* We’ve become an industry leader by providing quality — from the first Original Bodysuit® to the lasting careers we offer our team. We’ve kept our close-knit culture since our founding, and we invest in our teams with training and development programs, so we all succeed together. A Carter’s career doesn’t feel like a job. It feels like connections, between customers, teams, and families. Caring, teamwork, flexibility, and growth are what make us different. What’s not to love?

**Benefits we love:**

* Schedules that fit your life. Our hours of operation allow you to balance work and personal activities - whether you have class, enjoy a morning workout, or manage carpool.

  

* Benefits and perks that make life better, including mental health benefits, a 30% discount on our brands, referral bonuses, and much more!

  

* Advance You Program helps earn a GED or a bachelor’s degree tuition-free or learn English as a second language!

* The opportunity to learn and build skills and grow as an individual. We provide professional and personal development to help shape your career.

* Development programs to help you grow in your current role and beyond. Whether you’re looking to join us for a season or a long-term career, you can grow at Carter’s.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Become a product and brand expert of our brands to help families navigate every moment from preemie to size 14

* Welcome customers with a warm greeting and provide assistance with our product styles, features, and benefits

* Maintain a genuine customer focus on the sales floor

  

* Foster a positive, safe, and inclusive environment for employees and customers

* Consistently model service standards and omni-channel experience while coaching others to success

* Lead and execute an assigned business focus area through planning and detailed follow through

* Perform Leader on Duty supervisor responsibilities by driving results and responding to customer concerns timely and with an appropriate resolution

* Utilize customer feedback to identify areas of opportunity to implement actions to drive results

* Build customer loyalty through Company sponsored programs, including credit

* Offer consistent, in the moment feedback to store team and raise performance concerns to Store Manager

* Recognize exceptional performance through positive reinforcement and appreciation

* Support store team with Asset Protection through a consistent level of customer service, safety awareness, and operational controls

**Qualities we’d love in a candidate:**

* A positive and solutions-oriented mindset

* Effective and professional verbal and written communication skills

* The ability to manage multiple tasks at once

* Proficient computer and technology skills (Outlook, Excel, Web navigation, etc.)

* A variety of skills and experiences

* A high school diploma or GED

  

**You can:**

* Lift 40 pounds as needed, with frequent bending, stooping, reaching, pushing, and pulling

* Stand or walk for extended periods of time; climb up and down a ladder

* Provide availability that may include days, nights, weekends, and holidays as scheduled

**Carter’s for all:**

Carter's is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. (Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran).

**Additional information:**

Applications will be accepted until at least 7 days after the posting date.

Carter's does not use AI to make any decision in our hiring process.

NOTE: This job description is not all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description. Carter’s may reasonably alter your duties, responsibilities, job title, and location.

* Source: Circana/ Consumer Tracking service, U.S. dollar share, 12 months ending September 2023.

Compensation for this position ranges from $19.25 - $23.25 per hour based on experience and location.

*Carters is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.*

jobs.title: Fractional CFO
jobs.description:
The Cash Flow CFO is a fractional CFO and full-service accounting firm that empowers scaling businesses to make informed, data-driven financial decisions that significantly boost profitability. We serve entrepreneurs, innovative businesses, and more established companies who, like us, think outside the corporate box and are driven by a passion to create opportunities and growth. Internally, we are a virtual team of seasoned CFOs, Controllers, and Accounting experts who collaborate to enable business owners to achieve substantial financial goals, expand impact, and increase personal wealth.

The Cash Flow CFO is looking to add additional CFO Consultants to our Fractional CFO Team.

**Job Overview**

As a CFO Consultant, you’ll leverage your accounting and finance expertise and strong analytical skills to deliver hands-on financial guidance and actionable insights to a diverse portfolio of small business clients.

The ideal candidate excels at managing multiple client relationships and brings high-level communication and a collaborative, entrepreneurial mindset to every client interaction. This position is for you if you’re a resourceful self-starter, have a passion for empowering, mentoring, and storytelling with numbers, and have the drive to make a measurable impact on the success of small businesses.

**Job Details**

* Takes the time to understand each client’s business and advises on profit growth strategies
* Prepares and presents financial analysis, insights, and recommendations
* Leads client financial meetings, delivering high-energy, engaging sessions
* Provides direct, confident financial guidance and education to clients of varying financial acumen; acts as a dedicated advocate for their financial interests
* Conducts gap, scenario, and what-if analyses for client businesses; identifies opportunities for financial improvement and measurable impact
* Uses critical thinking to help clients become more profitable and manage their costs
* Collaborates with the client’s accounting teams
* Demonstrates flexibility and adaptability in ambiguous environments
* Exhibits a strong leadership presence that empowers and guides clients
* Mentors and shares expertise with peers; supports team learning
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Requirements**

* Experience in accounting and finance roles with previous hands-on involvement in core accounting functions
* Ability to analyze data and identify opportunities for financial improvement and growth
* Experience managing multiple clients or projects simultaneously
* Exposure to multiple industries and business models
* High-level client-facing communication and presentation skills, including the ability to adapt messaging to varying financial acumen
* Self-motivation and the ability to work independently without extensive supervision

**Position Structure**

* Remote; must reside and work within the U.S.
* **W2 position**
* Full-time and Part-time opportunities available
* Full-time pay is between $95,000 and $120,000 per year. For part-time positions, the pay will be less.
* Full-time team members manage 6-8 clients.

**Benefits**

* Paid Time Off
* Health Insurance
* Life Insurance
* 401(k) plan
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Long-Term Disability
* Short-Term Disability

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $95,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
* Work from home

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional CTO
jobs.description:
***Note on Compensation***  
*This position is currently offering anywhere between 5-20% equity in the company with no cash compensation or salary until seed funding round is complete.*

**Position Summary** Ecopreneur is seeking a Founding Chief Technology Officer to co-build the future of community-powered education. This is a ground-floor opportunity to architect, shape, and scale a platform that helps students discover purpose through meaningful service, exploration, and real-world engagement.

You will work directly with the co-founders to design and evolve our technical foundation, product roadmap, and long-term systems strategy. This role blends hands-on building with strategic leadership. You will help translate vision into infrastructure, ideas into usable tools, and values into systems that serve schools, students, and communities with care.

This is an ideal role for someone who thrives in ambiguity, enjoys building with intention, and wants meaningful ownership in what they create.

**About Ecopreneur** Ecopreneur is an EdTech platform helping schools modernize how students engage with service learning, career exploration, and community partnerships. Our mission is to help young people find purpose, belonging, and direction through real-world engagement that benefits both students and their communities.

We work with middle and high schools to streamline volunteer tracking, partnerships, and student engagement while supporting administrators with compliance, reporting, and insights. Our long-term vision is to become the connective tissue between education, community organizations, and future pathways — without losing the human element.

Our values guide everything we build:

* Sustainability & Respect
* Innovation & Foresight
* Empowerment & Community
* Balance & Wellbeing
* People & Cultural Identity
* Integrity & Transparency

**Objectives** As CTO, you will be responsible for shaping the technical foundation and long-term scalability of Ecopreneur.

Core objectives include:

* Architect and evolve the platform’s technical infrastructure to support growth, security, and reliability.
* Translate product vision into scalable technical systems and workflows.
* Lead technical decision-making with long-term sustainability in mind.
* Collaborate closely with the COO to align product, mission, and execution.
* Oversee development of features supporting student engagement, admin workflows, and data insights.
* Ensure responsible data handling, privacy alignment (FERPA-conscious design), and ethical system architecture.
* Establish engineering best practices, documentation, and development workflows.
* Evaluate and implement tools, frameworks, and integrations as the platform evolves.
* Support experimentation, iteration, and user feedback loops.
* Prepare the platform for future scale, partnerships, and funding readiness.

**Competencies** We’re not looking for perfection. We’re looking for alignment, curiosity, and capability.

Core competencies include:

* Systems thinking and technical architecture
* Product-minded engineering
* Full-stack or strong backend experience (stack flexible)
* Strategic planning and technical roadmapping
* Clear communication with non-technical stakeholders
* Comfort with ambiguity and early-stage problem solving
* Ethical and privacy-conscious development
* Leadership through collaboration, not hierarchy
* Ability to balance speed with sustainability
* Continuous learning and adaptability

**Education and Experience** We care more about how you think and build than where you studied.

Ideal experience includes:

* Experience building or leading technical development for a startup or early-stage product.
* Comfort owning architecture decisions end-to-end.
* Experience working on SaaS platforms, data-driven products, or education-related tools is a plus.
* Familiarity with user-centered design and iterative development.
* Experience collaborating with non-technical founders or cross-functional teams.
* A track record of shipping meaningful products, not just prototypes.

If you’re self-taught, career-switching, or have a nontraditional background, we want to hear from you.

**Physical Requirements** This is a remote-first role. Occasional travel may be optional for team sessions, school visits, or partner meetings as the company grows.

**Commitment to Diversity** Ecopreneur is committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and values-driven team. We believe meaningful innovation comes from diverse lived experiences and perspectives. We encourage candidates of all backgrounds, identities, and paths to apply.

Pay: From $1.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Are you comfortable in receiving no cash compensation for this role until post seed funding round is complete and receiving anywhere between 5-20% equity in the company in lieu of cash compensation for the time being?
* How many hours a week can you contribute to this role?

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) – B2C Personal Injury
jobs.description:
Payne Law Firm is a growing personal injury law firm focused on helping injured individuals and their families secure the compensation they deserve. The firm seeks a strategic Fractional Chief Marketing Officer to lead consumer-focused marketing, drive qualified case leads, and strengthen the firm’s brand in a highly competitive market.​**Responsibilities**

* Develop and own a B2C marketing strategy to consistently generate high-quality personal injury leads (motor vehicle, premises liability, workplace injuries, etc.).​
* Plan and oversee multi-channel marketing: SEO, PPC/Google Ads, LSAs, social media, TV/radio/outdoor, and referral campaigns.​
* Optimize the firm’s website, landing pages, and intake funnels to maximize conversions from calls, chats, and form submissions.​
* Manage marketing budget, vendors, and agencies; negotiate contracts and hold partners accountable to performance KPIs.​
* Implement tracking and analytics to measure cost per lead, cost per signed case, and overall marketing ROI.​
* Guide brand positioning, messaging, and creative to build trust, authority, and visibility in the local market.​
* Collaborate closely with attorneys and intake staff to align marketing promises with client experience and case selection goals.​
* Provide executive-level reporting and recommendations to the firm’s partners on growth opportunities and marketing risks.​

**Qualifications**

* 2+ years of marketing experience, including leadership responsibility for strategy and budget.
* Proven success in B2C lead generation, preferably in legal, healthcare, or other high-intent, service-based industries.​
* Strong grasp of digital marketing for local services: SEO, PPC, LSAs, reviews/reputation, and conversion optimization.​
* Experience working with or within law firms or other professional services is strongly preferred.​
* Highly analytical, with experience setting up and interpreting marketing dashboards and KPIs.​
* Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate with attorneys, intake teams, and external vendors.​

Job Types: Contract, Part-time

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Development & Contract Director
jobs.description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**DIRECTOR PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT, AND CONTRACT MANAGEMENT**

We all Really Matter (WARM) is the leading grassroots, minority-led CBO 501 ( c ) 3 provider of comprehensive services for victims of domestic violence in greater Harlem and the South Bronx. WARM’s mission is to prevent and interrupt the cycle of abuse for women and communities of color.

Reporting directly to the Executive Director, with wide latitude for independent judgment, the Director of Planning, Development, and Contract Management will serve as a member of the Executive Management Team. The Director will be the principal creator of and eventual liaison to the Development Committee of the Board of Directors and key organization members, as WARM continues to rapidly grow its services and geographic reach.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Fundraising**

● Drive revenue generating activities to meet the budget of existing, expanded, and new programs

● Identify and secure funds from three levels of government and foundations/corporations ● Develop proposals for current programs and new funding opportunities ● Supervise staff as WARM hires development consultants and assistants ● Develop and implement major donor campaign; work with board, executive staff, and

consultants to identify, increase, and manage a portfolio of donors; maintain ongoing relationships with major donors

● Oversee organization of special events, with the goal of increasing net revenue ● Manage the implementation of Raiser’s Edge and oversee staff responsible for data entry and gift processing

● Maintain and monitor monthly chart of proposals and reports due and ensure products are of the best quality and submitted on time

● Generate donor communications, newsletters, and annual fundraising reports ● Assist in creation of print, digital, and social media content in support of fundraising

**Planning**

● Develop and execute WARM’s annual fundraising plan to meet expense budgets for programs, capital, infrastructure, and fund balance needs

● Create and execute a strategy for increased general support revenue through individual donors, special events, foundations/corporations, and new revenue sources ● Coordinate development planning with program directors/supervisors for new and existing programs

**Contract Management**

● Monitor all government, foundation, and corporate contracts to meet goals, objectives, outcomes, and deliverables

● Draft contracts and/or oversee contract development for funded government proposals ● Develop quality assurance capacity with CEO, formulate corrective action plans and monitor results

● Oversee contract management system, including progress reports to funders and maintenance of a contract management database

● Review and approve justifications for contract budget and program modifications ● Prepare and present regular reports to CEO/board on progress towards fundraising goals

**Qualifications/Competencies**

● Passion for and identification with agency mission

● BA (MA or equivalent preferred) and seven plus years’ experience as a professional fundraiser for sizable non-profit organizations, including five years in a leadership role ● Demonstrated success scaling funding for a non-profit organization

● Proven record of attracting and securing significant grants form government, corporations and foundations

● Demonstrated ability to raise funds through major donors and special events ● Strong financial management skills, including budgeting

● Experience with database systems and procedures of donor tracking and reporting ● Microsoft Office and spreadsheet proficiency

● Experience with online fundraising, email marketing, and internet research ● High energy, proactive, results-oriented; able to set and surpass goals; ability to influence and persuade key stakeholders; comfortable working with a high degree of autonomy and responsibly; exceptional ability to work with teams; well-organized with close attention to detail and follow-through; strong executive presence; strategic, creative, progressive thinker; strong interpersonal, verbal communication and presentation skills

**Salary:** $125k

Benefits: Personal Days, Wellness Days, Vacation & Paid Time Off

Schedule: Full-time, Monday – Friday

Work Location: 8 West 126th Street, 3rd Floor, NY, NY 10027

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Business Operations & Analytics Specialist (Part TIme)
jobs.description:
**Job Title:** Part Time Business Operations & Analytics

Are you seeking a role that has flexible hours, makes a positive impact in the community and leverages your business skills? We'd love to hear from you!

**About Buttonloop:** Buttonloop Children’s Therapies is an award winning, pediatric practice that offers speech, occupational, and feeding therapies to children in the North Shore area. Our hope is that changing the world for one child will unlock their power to change the world. Buttonloop offers a collaborative, team environment. We pride ourselves on excellence and prioritize continued professional development for our team.

**Job Summary:**

We are looking for a part time Business Operations & Analytics Specialist to support the Executive Director/CEO of the business in driving strategic decision-making through data analysis, optimize team performance and support growth initiatives. In this role, you will leverage your analytic skills and work with our Leadership Team to define strategies that support productivity & quality initiatives and provide the administrative support necessary to implement these strategies to achieve measurable results.

**Responsibilities:**

**1. Business Intelligence & Analysis:**

* Maintain monthly and quarterly dashboards and reports to visualize data and performance results to employees and key stakeholders.
* Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions support decision-making, and explore strategic growth initiatives
* Track quarterly key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure demand, utilization, and business performance.
* Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization based on data analysis

**2. Program Management/Support:**

* Manage bi-annual bonus program
* Support metrics for annual performance cycles
* Monitor health of offsite partnerships via tracking of patient referrals & visits
* Support Office Manager with caregiver policy enforcement (behavior & attendance)
* Translate data-driven insights into actionable plans and gather stakeholder support in order to effectively implement programming

3. **Admin:**

* Support key stakeholders with administrative tasks related that support patient/partner onboarding, program management, student hiring, performance management and marketing.

**Soft Skills:**

* Team player who is passionate about making a positive impact for kids and families in the North Shore
* Someone who thrives in a casual, in office work setting
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Good listening skills and ability to influence team members to achieve goals

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in a service business, ideally medical services or field service organization
* Proven experience optimizing team performance to improve productivity and customer service outcomes
* Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Business Administration, or a related quantitative or operations field
* Minimum 5 years demonstrated career progression in a Finance or Business Operations role
* Strong analytical skills including forecasting, modeling and data analysis
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey data insights effectively.
* Financial statement analysis and related financial risk and mitigation strategies (plus)

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $30.00 - $40.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid parental leave
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Application Question(s):

* Before moving forward, we’d love to confirm that you can commit to weekly in office schedule of 20 hours? Flexible on hours just need to be consistent each week.

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Business Operations or Finance: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

Advisory Solution Consultant - Partners
jobs.description:
**Company Description**

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

 **Job Description**

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. We make the world of work, work better for people.

We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.

Role:  
ServiceNow is seeking a Senior Solution Consultant to support our Global Partnerships and Channel partners. In this role, you will be expected to provide pre-sales support, technical product and architecture advice, and ongoing communication of the latest ServiceNow solutions and capabilities. You will assist our partners in building practices that deliver exceptional customer outcomes. Additionally, you will be responsible for evangelizing ServiceNow mindshare to our partner community to evolve a “ServiceNow First” approach, to sell effectively to their customers, and to extend the ServiceNow value proposition.

What you need to be successful in this role:

* 7+ years of Pre-Sales Solution Consulting experience
* 2+ plus years of ServiceNow experience
* 2+ plus years of Partner experience
* Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Computer Science, Engineering etc.
* Working knowledge of modern web technologies and cloud computing
* Experience and understanding of multiple technical domains - application, data, integration, big data, mobility, analytics, etc.
* Excellent understanding of the architectural principles for cloud-based platforms that include SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, and automation
* Intrinsically curious and passionate about researching current and emerging technologies and developing innovative solutions
* Quick adoption and understanding of industry/vertical business challenges and mapping how ServiceNow can help transform those verticals

* Strong facilitation skills, to encourage clear articulation of the business issues and effective solution design by the relevant players
* Sharp business judgment, ability to see "big picture" and to prioritize
* Executive presence, strong verbal and written communication
* Ability to manage change and ambiguity with an action-orientation/drive – must thrive in a dynamic environment
* Talented at explaining complex topics clearly and concisely, and effective at providing practical guidance
* Ability to collaborate and interact at multiple levels (Enterprise Architects, Technical Architects, Offering Managers, Directors, VP’s, and CXO’s)

  
**Qualifications**

**To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 7+ years of pre-sales solution consulting or sales engineering experience
* Experience that will help you stand out:
* Experience with the ServiceNow product suite or competitive product suites highly desirable
* A current ServiceNow certification (e.g. Certified System Administrator and/or Certified Implementation Specialist)
* ServiceNow platform development experience
* Experience developing on competitive platforms
* What you get to do in this role:
* Evangelize ServiceNow to partners through Sales Plays enablement and product demos
* Proactively manage relationships with executive and key partner stakeholders to build ServiceNow Mindshare
* Assist Partner Experience team on the execution of roadshows, shark camps, and partner events
* Provide subject matter expertise (SME) during planning, solutioning and EBC briefings. Explain core concepts of the ServiceNow platform and its value proposition
* Identify and collaborate on business development opportunities for market-differentiated Offerings/Solutions based on the ServiceNow platform and spearhead intake into the ServiceNow Built-On/Built-With program
* Mentor, guide, and model effective teamwork with ServiceNow and partner solution consultants to develop and apply new knowledge and skills. Collaborate, actively share knowledge, and promote best known methods amongst other ServiceNow Solution Consulting team members
* Takes responsibility as primary technical touchpoint with peers when partners are engaged within an account or pursuit
* Provide feedback, guidance, and advice on the 'Art of Story Telling' to partner solution consultants
* Create long term enduring relationships with partners and the senior leadership within those partners to understand their go to market strategy and attach ServiceNow into their client pursuits
* Demonstrates domain and technical expertise across multiple industry verticals knowing when to pull in the proper teams within ServiceNow to assist as needed
* For partners with true industry focus and credentials, provides a point of view (or brings in expertise) on where the entire ServiceNow platform is relevant for that industry, not just about industry SKUs
* Travel for Partner, Customer, and Organizational activities
* What we would love to see from you before or during an interview:
* Presentation and demonstration of our ServiceNow Story
* An inspiring portfolio of applications built on platforms such as ServiceNow
* Demonstration of any accessible projects you have built
* This role requires approximately 25% travel.

FD21

For positions in this location, we offer a base pay of $131,925 - $217,725, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.

 **Additional Information**

**Work Personas**

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

**Accommodations**

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

**Export Control Regulations**

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

As a member of our Solution Consulting team, you will have a major impact on our future success by supporting [Employee Experience, Customer Workflow, ITX] Solution Sales. You will guide revenue for one of our products with the support and partnership of Sales, Product Management, and the executive team. This is a hands-on technical consultant who can go wide and deep on solution delivery and solution positioning during sales cycles.

**What you get to do in this role:**

The Solution Consultant is a technical consultant with the advanced ability to develop, position and provide product-specific solutions during sales cycles while achieving quarterly and annual sales goals for an assigned territory.

* Support product sales as a technical and domain expert of a client-facing sales team
* Lead discovery workshops to determine customers' challenges and give product demonstrations to align our solution with customer needs
* Answer product feature and technical questions from customers, channel partners and ServiceNow colleagues
* Provide feedback to product management about product enhancements that can address customer needs and provide additional value
* Share and learn best practices and re-usable assets with other Solution Consultants to enhance the quality and efficiency of the team
* Stay current on competitive analysis and market differentiation
* Support marketing events including executive briefings, conferences, user groups, and trade shows

  
**Qualifications**

**To be successful in this role you have:**

* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* 7+ years of pre-sales solution consulting or sales engineering experience
* Proficiency with the ServiceNow platform or technical expertise with cloud software solutions
* Experience working collaboratively with product management, product marketing, partners, and professional services
* Territory management skills, including pipeline building and working with Sales counterpart to guide execution excellence
* Travel, as necessary

jobs.title: Inside Sales Representative- Part Time- Night Shift
jobs.description:
**Looking to make some extra money!!!**

**We are looking for Inside Sales Representative -****Must** be available for evenings and weekends **(initial shift hours : Monday- Friday 6:00pm - 10:00pm and Saturdays 6:00pm - 8:00pm ( 3-4 days per week). Sundays closed**

  

**Luxury Prospect Engagement & Appointment Conversion** — Handle a high volume of inbound and outbound interactions across phone, chat, and digital platforms (including RingCentral and Salesforce). Engage prospects with warmth, empathy, and authority to understand their goals and challenges. Convert these conversations into scheduled, in-person Hair Health Consultations, articulating the value of meeting with a Certified Hair Loss Specialist.

**Collaborative Handoff & Relationship Building** — Partner closely with Certified Hair Loss Specialists in assigned regions to ensure a seamless, “warm handoff” from the call center to the in-person consultation. Proactively follow up with prospects to confirm appointments, reinforce value, and sustain excitement leading up to their visit. Reconnect with clients who have paused or abandoned the scheduling process to re-engage them with empathy and renewed motivation.

**Lead Nurturing & Follow-Up Management** — Monitor and follow up with all prospects who schedule online, call in, or submit interest forms. Ensure no opportunity goes unaddressed by maintaining continuous outreach and communication until a successful appointment is completed.

**CRM Accuracy & Operational Excellence** — Maintain precise and timely documentation of all prospect interactions, outcomes, and notes in Salesforce. Uphold brand presentation and workspace standards, ensuring consistency with HairClub’s image of excellence. Participate in ongoing training to refine tone, communication, and conversion techniques

  

**ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Deliver a white-glove, luxury-level experience in every conversation—professional, confident, and human.
* Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of HairClub’s premium services, treatments, and personalized solutions.
* Partner with Certified Hair Loss Specialists by region to ensure alignment between scheduled appointments and local center readiness.
* Manage multiple communication channels (phone, chat, SMS, and email) with speed and consistency.
* Execute proactive outbound campaigns to re-engage leads, recover abandoned bookings, and drive new consultations.
* Maintain confidentiality of client information and demonstrate discretion in all communications.
* Achieve or exceed established appointment and attendance goals. Each agent is accountable for producing a minimum of 50 in-person shows bi-weekly.
* Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying client feedback trends and recommending enhancements to the prospect journey.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* **Must** be available for evenings and weekends **(initial shift hours : Monday- Friday 6:00pm - 10:00pm and Saturdays 6:00pm - 8:00pm ( 3-4 days per week). Sundays closed**
* **Bilingual (English/Spanish)** strongly preferred.
* Minimum **3+ years of luxury brand, consultative sales, or high-end service experience** (call center or hospitality).
* Proven success in high-touch client engagement and relationship development.
* Proficiency with **Salesforce CRM** and **RingCentral** preferred.
* Outstanding verbal communication, emotional intelligence, and follow-through.
* Demonstrated ability to multi-task, prioritize, and perform under time constraints.
* Self-motivated, coachable, and driven by performance excellence.

  

Receive the **best benefits in the industry**, including.

* This position is based in our Boca Raton Florida call center ($20.00 an hour base plus earn commissions)
* Leads and sales appointments are provided to you from our corporate marketing platform.
* Paid vacation days, paid holidays, and personal days starting the day you are hired!
* Comprehensive health benefits (medical, dental, life insurance and more)
* A 401(k)-retirement savings plan with company match after one year!
* Tuition reimbursement after one year!
* Company-paid training when you are hired and throughout your career with HairClub.

  

**Are you ready to make money and start a rewarding adventure? Apply now!**

  

HairClub is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating an inclusive work environment for everyone. We embrace and celebrate the unique experiences, perspectives and cultural backgrounds that each employee brings to our workplace. HairClub strives to foster an environment where our employees feel respected, valued and empowered, and our team members are at the forefront in helping us promote and sustain an inclusive workplace.

#### **Education**

Preferred

* High School or better

#### **Behaviors**

Preferred

* Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
* Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
* Team Player: Works well as a member of a group

#### **Motivations**

Preferred

* Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
* Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

jobs.title: Part-Time (20-25 hours/wk) Inside Sales Rep (100% Remote)
jobs.description:
**Job Overview**  
We are a small woman-owned and operated wholesale (B2B) electronics parts franchised distributor. We offer flexible work schedules during operational hours (M-F; 8 AM CST-5 PM CST) and a generous benefits package for qualified employees including medical, dental, vision, 401K.

Education or Work Experience Required

* College Degree or On-the-job experience equivalent
* Customer Service or Inside Sales experience, WHOLESALE preferred
* Supply Chain or Purchasing experience STRONGLY suggested, but not required.
* SAP Ariba experience a PLUS

Work with the sales team, purchasing and customers to provide sales service and support. Work with sales to enter over-run of orders on key customers. Work with sales to quote transactional business. Work closely with Purchasing to do forward looking expedites and coordinate inventory management and allocation. Use this data to keep open order reports updated weekly in order to easily respond to customers’ requests for updates. Identify strategic parts/schedules that need additional work and management involvement. Work closely with sales on weekly OOR.

**\*\*We are hiring ONE to TWO Part-Time Inside Sales Reps (100% Remote)\*\***

* Part-Time permanent position
* 20-25 hours a week
* Starts at $25/hour
* If you are near Georgetown, TX, there will be fun company events throughout the year!

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

The ISR is responsible to operate out of our order management system, build relationships with both customers and vendors, and follow up on orders to meet customers’ expectations. A ISR is primarily responsible for customer service-related and administrative tasks within the Purchasing and the Sales department. They must be excellent team players and be able to work well independently. We do not micromanage, so we must trust that the candidate can work independently and reach out to management for support and questions. They must possess strong communication skills, as they communicate information to co-worker’s, supervisors, company’s vendors, as well as to multiple customers. This is a great entry- to mid- level position that offers opportunities for professional development and career advancement to the right candidate.

* Expedite orders to provide on-time delivery to meet or exceed the customer’s demands
* Leverages the ERP system to resolves open Purchase Order issues, work with vendors to get updated delivery timelines and communicate issues with internal business partners
* Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers
* Develop and maintain relationships with customers
* Collaborate with sales, accounts payable, operations, product management,

**Qualifications Required for this Position**

A successful ISR candidate will have various prerequisite skills and qualifications needed to do their job effectively, which should include:

* Higher level of Excel proficiency is REQUIRED
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills REQUIRED
* Teamwork skills; collaboration and flexibility REQUIRED
* Attention to detail and thorough overview of communication is REQUIRED
* Math and analytical skills
* Proficiency in inventory management tools and accounting/ERP applications
* Excellent time management skills REQUIRED
* ERP is Epicor/P21, experience on this would be a plus but not required.

**Education or Work Experience Required**

* College Degree or On-the-job experience equivalent
* Customer Service or Inside Sales experience; wholesale preferred
* Supply Chain or Purchasing experience STRONGLY suggested, but not required.
* SAP Ariba experience a PLUS

**Remote Work Environment Requirements**

* Access to high-speed Wi-Fi, quiet and dedicated place to work, strong independent work ethic.

**What’s Next?**

* Excel and other ISR Skills Tests required prior to 1st interview
* 1st Interview (Video or Phone)
* Follow up interview will be requested for candidates selected

*All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Candidates applying for this role are required to have US residency at the time of application. Military families are encouraged to apply!*

*All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States and are required to have U.S. residency at the time of application.*

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $26,000.00 - $32,500.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Disability insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Work from home

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative (Part-Time)
jobs.description:
**About CounselFi**

CounselFi is a Finance as a Service (FaaS) B-Corp proudly helping small businesses across a range of industries with strategic finance advice. We engage in exciting work that makes a meaningful impact on startup founders and small business owners. We are committed to overhauling the back-office experience for small business owners, putting strategy at the forefront of decision-making.

#### **The Opportunity**

We're seeking a motivated Part-Time Cold Calling Sales Representative to help launch an exciting new service offering. This role offers a unique opportunity to work directly with our founder and CEO while making a meaningful impact on growing businesses that need strategic financial guidance.

#### **What You'll Do**

  

* Conduct 15-20 strategic cold calls per hour to targeted prospects using our ZoomInfo + HubSpot lead generation system
* Augment your calling with strategic email and LinkedIn outreach to create multiple touchpoints
* Help refine and evolve our outreach messaging and strategy across all channels based on real-world feedback and results
* Identify and qualify prospective clients who would benefit from our CFO expertise
* Document prospect feedback to help improve our value proposition
* Schedule discovery calls for qualified prospects with our leadership team
* Contribute to the development of our sales process during this exciting growth phase

#### **What Makes You a Great Fit**

  

* Proven comfort with cold calling and the resilience to persevere through rejection
* Natural ability to build rapport quickly and communicate complex value propositions clearly
* Self-starter mentality with the ability to work independently while following structured processes
* Genuine interest in business finance and helping companies grow
* Experience with CRM systems (HubSpot experience a plus)
* Strong listening skills and ability to identify prospect pain points

#### **Why You'll Love This Role**

* **Direct Mentorship**: Work alongside and learn directly from our founder and CEO
* **Meaningful Impact**: Connect businesses with financial expertise that transforms their ability to execute their strategy
* **Best-in-Class Tools**: Leverage our fully built-out CRM and lead generation systems (HubSpot + ZoomInfo) — **we provide access and training**
* **Supportive Resources**: Access to sales enablement materials including custom infographics and webinars
* **Growth Opportunity**: Help shape our sales process during a pivotal growth phase
* **Purpose-Driven Work**: Join a B-Corp committed to positive business impact

#### **Position Details**

  

* Part-time position: 15-20 hours per week
* Flexible scheduling available
* **Compensation: A Performance-Driven Partnership**
* + **Ramp-Up Guarantee:** To ensure your success, you’ll start with a guaranteed base of **$40/hour**. This provides stability as you learn our systems and master the script during the initial months.
  + **Transition to High-Commission:** The base rate is designed to transition towards a floor of $10/hour as your commission earnings rapidly grow and become the primary component of your pay.
  + **Lucrative Commission:** You'll earn **10% of the first year's Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR)** for every new client you bring in. With our model, just a few successful deals a month can significantly outperform a traditional hourly rate.
  + **Earning Potential:** A successful rep will quickly build a pipeline that allows them to maintain an effective hourly rate far exceeding $40/hour, with a clear path to doubling that within the first year. We provide the targets and the tools; you bring the drive.
* Remote work options available

#### **Performance Expectations**

* **Activity:** Maintain a consistent volume of approximately 15 strategic calls per hour.
* **Results:** Target of securing 2-5 new clients per month.

**We’re Hiring: Fractional Sales Executives (Healthcare Compliance & Safety)**

Tyber Edge is seeking **experienced Fractional Sales Executives** with **deep, existing relationships** across **hospital and health system operations, facilities, safety, and quality teams**.

This role focuses on expanding adoption of — a web-based **EOC, fire safety, and compliance rounding platform** for healthcare organizations ready to move beyond spreadsheets and manual inspections.

We’re looking for professionals who already work with or have strong networks among:

Fire alarm & sprinkler inspection firms, extinguisher testing, egress inspection providers, and facilities management outsourcers serving hospitals and health systems

EOC / Emergency Operations Committee members, Safety Officers, and Directors of Facilities, Plant Operations, and Support Services (acute & post-acute)

EVS, plant operations, and maintenance vendors with healthcare-specific programs tied to accreditation and survey readiness

Fire alarm, nurse call, access control, and security camera vendors bundling monitoring, maintenance, and compliance reporting

Infection prevention technology providers (hand-hygiene monitoring, RTLS-based compliance, infection control solutions) selling into quality and IP leadership

EVS providers offering infection-prevention cleaning programs, ATP testing, and audit tools connected to EOC and infection control rounds

PPE distributors (gowns, masks, gloves, eye protection) and fit-testing service providers engaged with supply chain and safety leaders

Firms focused on quality improvement, safety culture, accreditation readiness, and High-Reliability Organization (HRO) training

Vendors of digital leader rounding, patient experience, HCAHPS, service recovery, workforce management, and acuity-based staffing tools that complement safety and EOC workflows

Engagement Details

Fully remote  
Fractional / 1099 engagement  
Ideal for senior sales leaders, consultants, and industry connectors

**Interested or know someone who fits?**  
**Ujunwa.Mbaeri@tyberedge.com**

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Contract Research Sales Director
jobs.description:
Job Title: Contract Research Sales Director

Location: Remote (U.S.-based with Boston, MA preferred, with travel)

Department: Business Development / Commercial

Employment Type: Contract (Commission-Eligible)

About TICRO Bioservices

TICRO Bioservices is the contract research organization (CRO) division of Trudeau Institute, a nonprofit biomedical research institute with more than 140 years of scientific excellence. TICRO provides high-quality in vivo preclinical research to support early-stage vaccine and therapeutic development for pharmaceutical, biotechnology, academic, government, and nonprofit partners worldwide.

Our core expertise spans infectious disease, immunology, microbiology, and virology, including studies involving BSL-2 and BSL-3 pathogens of high relevance to human health. Using established and well-validated animal models, TICRO enables partners to assess efficacy, immune response, and mechanism of action in early-phase, non-GLP preclinical programs.

Role Overview

TICRO is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Contract Research Sales Director to drive revenue growth by expanding relationships with existing clients and developing new business across biotech, pharmaceutical, academic, government, and nonprofit sectors.

This is a front-line commercial role with direct responsibility for pipeline development, deal progression, and revenue generation. The successful candidate will serve as the primary commercial interface between TICRO and its partners, matching needs with compelling research solutions.

Key ResponsibilitiesBusiness Development & Revenue Growth

* Own and execute a targeted business development strategy to expand TICRO’s preclinical CRO portfolio, with a focus on infectious disease and immunology programs.
* Identify, qualify, and pursue new business opportunities with biotech, pharmaceutical, government, nonprofit, and academic organizations.
* Build, manage, and advance a robust sales pipeline from lead generation through contract execution to meet or exceed revenue targets.
* Monitor market trends, competitive offerings, and client needs to identify growth opportunities.
* Provide regular pipeline updates, revenue forecasts, and market intelligence to Trudeau Institute leadership.

Client Engagement & Relationship Management

* Serve as the primary commercial point of contact for prospective and active clients.
* Develop trusted, long-term relationships that drive repeat business, program expansion, and multi-year engagements.
* Engage clients through scientific discussions, meetings, and strategic check-ins to identify new opportunities.
* Represent TICRO at scientific conferences, partnering meetings, and industry events to generate leads and elevate brand presence.

Proposal Development & Contract Execution

* Coordinate with internal Scientific Study Directors to develop proposals, scopes of work, timelines, and budgets aligned with client objectives.
* Ensure confidentiality agreements (CDAs) and master services agreements (MSAs) are executed efficiently.
* Support contract discussions and negotiations in collaboration with Trudeau Institute leadership and administrative teams.

QualificationsRequired

* Bachelor’s degree in Life Sciences or a related field; advanced degree (MS, PhD, MBA) strongly preferred.
* 3+ years of experience in business development, sales, or client partnerships within a preclinical CRO, biotech, pharma, or scientific services environment.
* Demonstrated success generating new business and managing a sales pipeline.
* Strong understanding of preclinical study design, particularly in infectious disease, immunology, vaccines, or therapeutic development.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and relationship-building skills.

Preferred

* Existing network within biopharma, government, or nonprofit research communities.
* Experience selling or managing BSL-2 / BSL-3 preclinical services or in vivo efficacy programs.
* Familiarity with government or foundation funding mechanisms and research contracting processes.

Pay: $130,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Work Location: Remote
