jobs.title: Leadership Development Consultant – Executive Partnership (Fractional)
jobs.description:
***Are you a seasoned consultant or established leader with a strong professional network, and looking to scale your impact and recurring revenue?***

If you want to deliver meaningful transformation while generating flexible, high\-earning revenue, this strategic partnership may be an ideal fit.

This is not a traditional job. It is a performance\-based, high\-credibility partnership with Relationship Media, LLC, designed for senior professionals who want to help organizations rebuild trust, cohesion, and culture while creating meaningful income for themselves.

Founded by a 20\-year law enforcement veteran and former S.W.A.T. commander, our leadership system addresses one of today’s most urgent organizational challenges: The Relationship Gap, a $223B crisis of cultural disconnection affecting every sector.

Our training is practical, example\-driven, and immediately usable, anchored in our proprietary “Be Like Tony” and “Don’t Be Like Chad” leadership framework.

We provide the solution.  
You provide the relationships.  
Together, we equip leaders to rebuild culture, performance, and trust.

**The Strategic Opportunity: Certified Partner (Consultants / Coaches / Trainers)**  
We are selectively expanding a small, high\-level group of Certified Partners to bring this proven system to their networks and client base.

**This Opportunity Is Ideal For:**

* HR consultants, OD practitioners, leadership coaches, and boutique training firms.
* Consultants seeking a proven, high\-quality curriculum to expand their services with no additional fulfillment burden.

**As a Certified Partner, You Will:**

* Deliver our complete leadership curriculum under your own brand.
* Provide the training to your clients using our turnkey system.
* Retain a significant share of revenue.
* Add a scalable, recurring income stream without increasing hours.

This is a strong fit if you want to expand your offerings with a practical, high\-impact leadership system that produces measurable change and repeat business.

**Who Thrives in This Partnership**  
You may be an ideal partner if you are:

* An experienced consultant seeking a proven, credible system to expand your client impact.
* A retired or semi\-retired executive with trust\-based relationships and industry influence.
* A natural connector who understands the value of your network.
* Motivated by meaningful work, cultural transformation, and performance\-based income.

This partnership is designed for professionals who recognize that their relationships are their greatest asset.

**Next Step**  
If your background aligns with this strategic opportunity, we will follow up with details and schedule a brief, private conversation to assess mutual fit, opportunities, and next steps.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $1\.00 \- $500,000\.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Do you understand this is not a direct hire/salary position?
* Are you willing to work with a performance\-based structure where compensation is based solely on your performance?

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional Retail & B2B Expansion Lead (Contract / Part-Time)
jobs.description:
Smart Carts of Maine is one of the country's leading manufacturers of (1\) premium garden carts and utility carts, and (2\) premium cedar raised garden beds, planters, and outdoor furniture. Our products are sold direct\-to\-consumer and are increasingly gaining traction with professional users such as landscapers, garden centers, and institutional buyers.

Our products can be viewed on the below websites:

www.smartcarts.com

www.infinitecedar.com

We are seeking an experienced, hands\-on operator to help us build and execute growth through pallet programs targeting landscapers, garden centers, equestrian supply stores, marinas, and instructional buying channels— without adding heavy overhead or management layers.

**Role Summary**

We are hiring a **fractional, part\-time Retail \& B2B Expansion Lead** to own and execute our expansion into:

* Regional garden center chains
* Landscaper / contractor programs
* Select institutional buyers (equestrian supply stores, marinas, parks, campuses, etc.)

This is a **builder role**, not a “strategy\-only” position. You will be responsible for developing the programs, opening accounts, and creating repeatable processes that allow Smart Carts to scale without the founder becoming a bottleneck.

The role is ideal for someone who has:

* Led retail or B2B expansion at a small\-to\-mid\-sized consumer or durable goods company
* Strong relationships or experience with independent garden centers, regional chains, or pro customers
* A bias toward execution, not bureaucracy

**Responsibilities**

**Retail Expansion**

* Identify and prioritize regional garden center chains and independent store groups
* Lead outreach, pitch meetings, and line reviews
* Develop pilot programs (10–50 store tests)
* Negotiate wholesale pricing, terms, and seasonal buy\-ins
* Coordinate forecasting and launch timelines with internal operations

**Landscaper \& Contractor Programs**

* Design and launch a landscaper / pro customer program
* Define pricing tiers, minimums, and reorder cadence
* Build a simple outbound and inbound sales process
* Close initial anchor accounts and create repeatable playbooks

**Program \& Process Development**

* Help define a small number of “program SKUs” optimized for B2B and retail
* Build simple tools: pitch decks, one\-pagers, pricing sheets, reorder workflows
* Create a clear handoff process so accounts can be managed efficiently over time

**Collaboration**

* Work directly with the founder and operations team
* Provide clear feedback on pricing, packaging, and product\-market fit
* Recommend where additional investment (inventory, tooling, marketing) is justified by demand

**What This Role Is** ***Not***

* Not a big\-box national account executive role (yet)
* Not a people\-management role
* Not a strategy\-only advisory role
* Not a commission\-only sales job

This is a **hands\-on growth operator role**.

**Time Commitment**

* **10–20 hours per week**, flexible
* Remote\-friendly with potential occasional travel for key accounts (if needed)

**Compensation Structure**

We are intentionally designing this role to be affordable, performance\-aligned, and motivating.

**Path to expanded role** as volume grows (optional, not promised or required)

**Ideal Background**

* 7\+ years in retail sales, wholesale, or B2B expansion
* Experience with:
* Garden centers, outdoor products, tools, equipment, equestrian product sales, or durable consumer goods
* Regional retail chains and/or pro customer sales
* Comfortable selling products in the $200–$600 retail price range
* Entrepreneurial mindset; comfortable working without a large support team

**Why This Role Is Attractive**

* Real ownership of a growth function at an inflection point
* Direct impact on company scale and strategy
* High autonomy
* No corporate politics
* Clear upside if programs succeed
* Opportunity to grow with the business if mutually desired

Pay: $3,000\.00 \- $5,000\.00 per month

Benefits:

* Work from home

Application Question(s):

* Please provide a short note on your experience with retail, garden centers, or B2B programs
* Please share examples of accounts or channels you have helped launch or scale
* Please confirm that you are interested in a fractional / part\-time role

Experience:

* Sales: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional CFO and CPA
jobs.description:
**Company Overview**  
ECOJOHN is a pioneering manufacturer specializing in off\-grid waste management and water processing solutions, committed to delivering high\-quality, durable products for remote applications worldwide. Our innovative technology supports clients ranging from residential to large\-scale government and military operations, emphasizing sustainability and reliability.

**Fractional CFO / CPA (Retainer\-Based)**

**About the Role**

Ecojohn is seeking an experienced Fractional CFO / CPA to provide ongoing financial leadership, accounting oversight, and strategic planning on a retainer basis. This role is ideal for a hands\-on financial professional who can manage core accounting functions while also supporting leadership with cash flow management, financial modeling, and long\-term planning.

You will work closely with the executive team to strengthen financial systems, improve visibility into performance, and support Ecojohn’s continued growth in domestic and international markets.

**Key Responsibilities**

Accounting \& Bookkeeping

\- Oversee and/or manage monthly bookkeeping (QuickBooks)

\- Ensure accurate general ledger, reconciliations, and journal entries

\- Review AP/AR processes, inventory accounting, and COGS

\- Prepare and review monthly financial statements (P\&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

\- Maintain GAAP\-compliant accounting practices

Cash Flow \& Financial Planning

\- Develop and maintain rolling cash flow projections

\- Monitor burn rate, liquidity, and working capital needs

\- Improve forecasting tied to production schedules and sales pipeline

\- Identify cost controls, margin improvements, and pricing insights

CFO\-Level Strategic Support

\- Build financial models, budgets, and multi\-scenario forecasts

\- Support capital planning, equipment investments, and growth initiatives

\- Provide financial insight for new product lines and market expansion

\- Prepare financial reporting for lenders, investors, or strategic partners

\- Advise leadership on financial risks and opportunities

Tax \& Compliance (CPA)

\- Prepare or coordinate federal and state tax filings

\- Ensure proper sales tax compliance across multiple states

\- Support year\-end close and audit readiness

\- Provide proactive tax planning and compliance guidance

Qualifications

\- Active CPA license (required)

\- 10\+ years of accounting and finance experience

\- Experience as a Fractional CFO, Controller, or CFO

\- Strong understanding of manufacturing accounting and inventory

\- Proven expertise in cash flow forecasting and financial modeling

\- Proficient in QuickBooks

\- Strong communication skills with non\-financial stakeholders

Preferred Experience

\- Manufacturing or industrial equipment businesses

\- Capital\-intensive or project\-based operations

\- Founder\-led or growth\-stage companies

\- Fractional or consulting\-based engagements

Pay: From $2,000\.00 per month

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Director of Compliance (Fractional)
jobs.description:
**Director of Compliance (Fractional)**

  

Galt Pharmaceuticals is a purpose\-driven organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients by providing products that address unmet clinical needs. We empower entrepreneurs, support our employees, and make a positive impact in the communities we serve. We are seeking a highly motivated, self\-starting Director of Compliance to join our growing team!

 ***This is a part\-time (18\-20 hrs. per week) position. We provide a flexible and collaborative work environment with hybrid, coworking, and flex office space options! Our office is conveniently located in the Atlanta Metro area!***

 **Position Overview:**



Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer \& Co\-Founder, as the Director of Compliance, you will design, implement, and oversee Galt's ethics and compliance program, ensuring adherence to a dynamic landscape of federal, state, and international laws and regulations. This leadership role is critical to mitigating legal and financial risks, preventing misconduct, and promoting a strong culture of ethical conduct across the organization. In\-depth knowledge of FDA, OIG, EMA, DOJ, Medicare/Medicaid regulations and a strong understanding of healthcare laws such as the Anti\-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act, PDMA, GMP, GCP, and Sunshine Act is required. Candidates with contract management experience are encouraged to apply.

 **Responsibilities:**


* **Program Management:** Develop, execute, and continuously improve the corporate compliance program across all business units.
* **Risk Assessment \& Mitigation:** Identify compliance risks and vulnerabilities; conduct audits and reviews; develop corrective action plans; implement preventative strategies.
* **Regulatory Monitoring:** Stay abreast of evolving laws, regulations, and industry trends from regulatory bodies (FDA, EMA, DOJ, OIG, etc.) and industry codes (e.g., PhRMA Code). Ensure manufacturing and vendor relationships are compliant.
* **Policy Development:** Draft, update, and maintain compliance policies, SOPs, and the corporate code of conduct.
* **Training \& Communication:** Lead the development and delivery of compliance training for employees and third parties; foster a culture of compliance through clear, effective communication.
* **Internal Investigations:** Oversee or assist in investigations of potential compliance violations; document findings and ensure appropriate corrective action.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Serves as a liaison between outside counsel and/or consulting services; serves as a strategic partner and compliance advisor to senior management, legal counsel, medical and regulatory affairs, and cross\-functional teams; represent Galt during regulatory inspections and client audits.
* **Reporting:** Prepare and present reports on compliance activities, program effectiveness, and risk metrics to senior leadership and compliance committees.
* **Compliance and Administration:** Ensure contracts, programs, business initiatives comply with corporate policies, legal requirements, and industry regulations, and maintain organized records.
* Performs other duties, as assigned.

  


**Professional Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (science, law, business administration, or related discipline). Master's or JD preferred.
* Minimum 5 years experience in the pharmaceutical, healthcare, or biotech industry, with at least 3–5 years in a compliance leadership or managerial role.
* Pharmaceutical Compliance Certification (Certified Pharmaceutical Industry Professional (CPIP), Certified in Healthcare Compliance (CHC), or Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) Certified Professional, etc.) is preferred.
* Experience with federal reimbursement, discounts, rebates, and pricing is a plus.
* Proven leadership skills and experience managing teams and cross\-functional projects.
* Self\-starter with the ability to work independently and proactively with minimal supervision.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated ability to translate complex regulations into clear policies and effective training.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities, particularly in risk assessment and solution development.
* High ethical standards and integrity, with the ability to build trust and credibility across all stakeholders.

  


**Employment Requirements:**


* Must pass a background check.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

  


**What's the Culture like at Galt?**

 **We're not your traditional pharmaceutical company! At Galt, our company culture is dynamic, employee\-focused, and entrepreneurial. We take pride in offering a career experience that makes you eager to come to work every day. Our environment is built on continuous improvement, fueled by collaboration and diverse perspectives, where challenging problems are solved together!**

 **At Galt, you'll find daily opportunities to learn, grow, and inspire those around you. You'll join a team of self\-starters, each motivated to make a real impact in every interaction. We value flexibility with work hours and understand the importance of life outside the office, empowering you to achieve your best both professionally and personally!**

jobs.title: Fractional Executive Director
jobs.description:
**Executive Director – The Hyacinth Fellowship**

**Location:** Remote (U.S.\-based)

**Reports to:** Board of Directors

**Status:** Part\-Time Contract Employee (approx. 15 hours per week)

**Compensation:** $25,000 annual

**About the Organization**

The Hyacinth Fellowship is the only organization worldwide dedicated to supporting individuals who have unintentionally killed or seriously injured others. We offer peer support, education, outreach, and community\-building. We help people heal, grow, and find purpose. Our programs include monthly fellowship meetings, an expressive writing group, a book club group, peer support, webinars, in\-person gatherings, and collaborations with mental health professionals and researchers.

**Position Summary**

The Executive Director serves as the chief executive officer of The Hyacinth Fellowship, responsible for providing strategic leadership, operational management, and board partnership to achieve the organization’s mission and strategic objectives. The ED will work closely with the Board of Directors and volunteers to advance the Fellowship’s mission and expand its reach and impact. The ED will also serve as a spokesperson for the Fellowship.

**Key Responsibilities**

Strategic Leadership \& Governance

* Partner with the Board of Directors to develop and implement strategic plans
* Help to steer volunteer support from the Board of Directors and other volunteers
* Ensure organizational compliance with legal, financial, and reporting requirements

Operations \& Program Oversight

* Oversee and execute weekly administrative and programmatic functions
* Manage quarterly budgets and financial reporting, coordinating with bookkeepers/accountants as needed
* Oversee quarterly maintenance of website, coordinating with contractors as needed

Fundraising \& Development

* Assist in overseeing regular fundraising efforts, including donor cultivation, partnership development, or grant writing
* Identify funding opportunities

Communications \& Community Engagement

* Oversee responses to e\-mail and phone inquiries
* Oversee monthly newsletters to members
* Oversee management of social media accounts
* Act as a spokesperson and ambassador for the organization

**Qualifications**

Required

* Proven leadership experience in non\-profit or mission\-driven organizations
* Strong strategic thinking and organizational management skills
* Excellent written and verbal interpersonal ability
* Self\-starter comfortable working independently with minimal administrative support
* Deep empathy and understanding of the Fellowship’s mission
* Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion

Preferred

* Experience growing small nonprofits or start\-up organizations
* Demonstrated success in fundraising
* Familiarity with peer support models
* Familiarity with trauma\-informed care
* Lived experience with unintentional harm

Job Type: Part\-time

Pay: $22,000\.00 \- $25,000\.00 per year

Expected hours: 15 per week

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Controller - Part Time
jobs.description:
**Controller Job Description**

* JOB TYPE: Part\-Time
* JOB LOCATION: 100% Virtual
* CATEGORY: Finance and Accounting


Preferred CFO is an outsourced/fractional CFO firm providing premium Finance, Accounting, HR and Payroll assistance to growing and emerging companies. We are seeking a dynamic and accomplished individual to assume the outsourced controllership position for a select group of our existing clients. This position delivers part\-time/outsourced controller services to a variety of companies simultaneously. Being a key team member for several different clients provides the controller with broad exposure to different businesses, management styles, and best practices. As a trusted advisor to the executive management teams within these companies, the controller is expected to oversee the tactical finance and accounting function within the company.  



  

Preferred CFO is a fully remote office, we have never had an office in out 10\+ years. Very flexible, fun, work environment. As a small company, we do not offer benefits, however, if you go to healthcare.gov, you can see the options you have for benefits.

**Responsibilities**

* Oversee the day\-to\-day accounting work of the accountant assigned to the client
* Maintain general ledger and chart of accounts
* Complete the month\-end close workbook for each client on a timely basis (i.e. no later than the 10th day after month end)
* Reconcile all balance sheet and income statement accounts as part of the monthly close process
* Assist the assigned CFO with the monthly reporting package
* Prepare and record general journal entries, primarily for more complex accounting areas or areas involving judgment and estimates (i.e. revenue recognition)
* Develop strong working relationships with clients and other stakeholders
* Provide leadership and support to junior accountants
* Report risk issues and potential opportunities to the assigned CFO
* Suggest and implement operational best practices within the finance and accounting department
* Employ good, sound judgment and become a trusted advisor within the company
* Develop and manage financial controls in accordance with the company's procedures
* Generate qualified leads for future engagements by networking with other professional trusted advisors

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance required (CPA, MBA or MAcc a plus)
* QuickBooks Certified (within 90 days of hire)
* Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required
* Bill.com and Expensify experience a plus
* Strong and verifiable technical accounting skills
* Ability to plan, direct, and control the tactical accounting function for multiple client companies at any given time
* A decisive individual who possesses a "big picture" perspective and is well versed in implementing and maintaining effective accounting controls and systems
* Ability to analyze existing operations and recommend and implement both revised and new policies, procedures, and systems

jobs.title: PACE Controls/PACE AI: Fractional Controller (Hybrid)
jobs.description:
**About PaceControls/PACE AI**

PaceControls is a machine learning and smart edge technology company focused on building smarter infrastructure. Our proven, scalable solutions for Smart Grid, Smart Buildings, and Smart Cities help reverse climate change, build better infrastructure, and deliver active risk management. We're growing rapidly and working with global partners to scale our impact.

**Position Overview**

We are seeking an experienced and detail\-oriented hybrid (in office 2\-3 days/week) Fractional Controller to join our finance team in Princeton, New Jersey. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will partner with our accounting team to strengthen financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and support strategic business decisions through accurate financial management and reporting.

This is a fractional role ideal for an experienced financial professional familiar with managerial accounting seeking flexible engagement with a growing technology company that will provide a gateway to a future FTE role.

**Key Responsibilities**

· Oversee the accounting function and work closely with the CFO and accounting staff to manage the company's financial operations.

· Ensure accurate and timely financial reporting in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles and all applicable regulations.

· Develop and implement accounting policies and procedures to enhance operational efficiency and internal controls.

· Prepare and analyze financial statements, budgets, and forecasts to support management decision\-making.

· Manage the general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll processes.

· Conduct reconciliations of balance sheet accounts and investigate discrepancies.

· Familiarity with selecting and/or implementing financial/accounting software packages (e.g. Oracle Financials, QB professional, Hyperion, Alvalara, etc.)

· Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals.

· Assist with financial planning, cash flow management, and working capital optimization.

· Manage relationship with bank and external accountants.

· Negotiate credit and/or payment terms with vendors.

· Mentor and support the accounting team in their professional development.

**Required Qualifications**

· Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field, with certification as a CPA, CMA, or CIA preferred.

· 5 or more years of experience as a Controller, Controller, or in a similar senior accounting leadership role.

· Possess strong knowledge of US GAAP and financial reporting standards.

· Demonstrate expertise in accounting software systems and advanced proficiency with Excel.

· Solid experience with budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.

· Exhibit strong communication skills and the ability to translate financial information for non\-financial audiences.

· You are based in New Jersey and willing to work from a New Jersey location.

**Preferred Qualifications**

· Experience in technology, cleantech, or infrastructure sectors.

· Experience with venture\-backed or rapidly scaling companies.

· Familiarity with internal audit functions and SOX compliance.

· Knowledge of multi\-entity accounting and consolidation processes.

**“What We Offer”**

· Flexible, fractional arrangement with defined scope and expectations.

· Competitive compensation based on experience and engagement level.

· Opportunity to work with a mission\-driven team focused on climate and sustainability impact.

· Exposure to machine learning and smart infrastructure technology.

· Collaborative relationship with experienced CFO and accounting team.

Pay: $75\.00 \- $120\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10\.0 – 40\.0 per week

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Princeton, NJ 08542

jobs.title: Fractional Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
**About Malloy Industries**

helps growth\-stage CEOs scale from $1M\-$50M in annual revenue by connecting them with relentlessly generous fractional executives who deliver strategic leadership without the full\-time price tag. Over the past five years, we’ve served 125\+ companies through our network of 400\+ fractional executives, maintaining an 80%\+ customer retention rate and a 95%\+ placement success rate.

We’re a delightfully tiny, fully remote team that operates on five core values: relentlessly generous, vulnerably trustworthy, enthusiastically fun, independently productive, and flexibly learning. We expect our team to go the extra mile for clients and each other, bring their whole selves to work (Brené Brown style), infuse every meeting with laughter and dad jokes, work autonomously without micromanagement, and Google their way to victory when facing new challenges.

**Customer Success Manager Job Description**

We’re seeking a fractional Customer Success Manager who thrives at the intersection of client success, project management, and strategic growth. This is not a traditional customer success role—you’ll be the trusted advisor to both our fractional executives and the CEOs who hire them, ensuring exceptional service delivery while identifying opportunities to expand relationships. You’ll manage a book of 5\-15 clients and coordinate 5\-25 active fractional executives, serving as the connective tissue that makes our marketplace hum.

In a typical week, you’ll conduct 1\-5 client check\-ins, guide new clients through our Strategic Clarity \& Matchmaking Program™, monitor fractional executive performance, and strategically identify upsell opportunities within our portfolio. You’ll spend roughly 50% of your time on client success, 30% on delivery coordination during Month 1 engagements, and 20% on expanding existing relationships with additional fractional roles or extended engagements.

You have strong relationship management skills. You possess excellent communication skills, fluency in English, proven client\-facing experience, and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision while managing multiple client relationships simultaneously. You know how to clearly communicate internally on Slack.

This role reports to our Chief of Staff, Tina Moriarty, and offers a clear path to Customer Success Director as we scale. You’ll receive abundant learning opportunities, continuing education support, and professional development resources to grow alongside our business.

**What You’ll Do**

**Client Relationship Management**

* Conduct 1\-5 weekly check\-ins with fractional executives and client companies to ensure service quality, alignment, and satisfaction
* Serve as the primary point of contact for ongoing client communications, acting as a trusted advisor to C\-level executives
* Monitor fractional executive performance against Malloy Industries standards and client expectations
* Run professional client meetings with confidence, clarity, and strategic insight

**Strategic Clarity \& Matchmaking Program™ Delivery**

* Guide new clients through our Month 1 onboarding process, ensuring seamless transitions and early wins
* Conduct a full Scalable Operational Maturity Assessment™ across finance, operations, HR, marketing, sales, and leadership functions
* Complete additional assessments, which may require you to ask scripted questions on Zoom, share your screen, and take notes based on responses
* Write, review, and/or deliver weekly Trust\-building Progress Snapshot (TPS) Reports™ to ensure transparent communication and alignment on all project activities
* Identify bottlenecks preventing the Client from scaling to include in the Fractional Executive Scope of Work (SOW) documents
* Collaborate on a Prioritized Action Plan
* Use our proprietary AI matchmaking algorithm to identify top candidates
* Screen, vet, and/or interview the best Fractional Executive candidates to present the top 1\-3 candidates with video responses and profiles to the Client
* Facilitate Client and candidate interviews and the selection process

**Growth \& Revenue Expansion**

* Identify upsell and expansion opportunities within your client portfolio, including active listening about needs for additional fractional roles, extended engagements, and/or complementary services
* Leverage our to match client needs with the right expertise
* Nurture strategic account relationships that increase client lifetime value
* Collaborate with leadership to develop and execute account\-based growth strategies
* Recommend custom gifts for clients

**Communication \& Coordination Excellence**

* Coordinate between fractional executives, clients, and internal team members to align on goals, deliverables, and timelines
* Track engagement progress, deadlines, and deliverables across multiple simultaneous placements
* Respond promptly to client and fractional executive emails with thoughtful, strategic communication
* Coordinate and send calendar invites for client meetings, check\-ins, and strategic reviews
* Follow up after every meeting with clear action items, next steps, and accountability
* Prepare client reports, presentations, and strategic recommendations as needed

**Administrative \& Strategic Support**

* Utilize HubSpot, Notion, Slack, and Google Workspace to manage client data, communications, and project tracking
* Support marketing efforts by capturing client success stories and testimonials
* Conduct research on client industries and competitive landscapes to inform strategic recommendations
* Maintain confidentiality and attention to detail across all client interactions

**What You Bring**

**Essential Qualifications**

* 5\+ years of client\-facing experience, preferably with C\-level executives in B2B services environments
* Experience working with a services business (consulting, agencies, professional services, fractional work, etc.)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to run professional meetings independently
* Strong organizational and time\-management skills to manage multiple client relationships simultaneously
* Proven ability to be highly responsive to emails, coordinate meetings, and follow up with action items
* Self\-motivated to work independently \& take initiative without micromanagement
* Must have access to and regularly use a dual monitor setup to support efficient multitasking and customer success work
* Available at least 10 hours/week for remote work with reliable internet and video conferencing capabilities
* Generally available Monday\-Friday, 9am\-5pm ET for client meetings (flexible schedule otherwise)

**Nice\-to\-Have Experience**

* Consulting experience at a large firm
* Customer success or account management experience with revenue expansion responsibilities
* Sales experience with demonstrated success in B2B environments
* Proficiency in CRM systems (HubSpot preferred)
* Familiarity with Notion, Slack, and project management tools

**Personal Attributes**

* Strategic and thoughtful communicator who can translate complex ideas into clear action
* Keen attention to detail
* Comfortable with revenue\-generating activities and growth conversations
* Enthusiastic about building trust\-based relationships with clients and fractional executives
* Highly aligned with our core values of relentlessly generous, vulnerably trustworthy, enthusiastically fun, independently productive, and flexibly learning

**Work Environment:**

This is a remote position with a flexible work location. You will need a reliable internet connection and access to your own computer. While you have flexibility in your schedule, you should generally be available Monday through Friday, 9 am \- 5 pm ET, for client meetings. You’re welcome to have other clients or commitments as long as you proactively communicate your availability and can dedicate at least 10 hours per week to this role.

**How to Apply**

* Email all of the materials to our Chief of Staff at tina@malloyindustries.com and CC: hello@malloyindustries.com
* Submit your resume
* Submit a cover letter including a list of your skills, focusing on your client success experience and any sales achievements (Ensure you have set permissions to anyone can edit the document)
* Submit your hourly rate requirements
* Submit a 3\-5 minute video of yourself answering these questions and provide a link for us to watch it:
* Why are you interested in this position?
* What do you know about Malloy Industries and the fractional executive industry?
* How do you plan to balance customer success, client service, and revenue growth objectives for this role?
* What sales experience (if any) do you have, and how would you identify growth opportunities with our clients?
* Where do you see yourself in 5 years, and how can this role help you get there?

Job Types: Part\-time, Contract

Pay: $30\.00 \- $50\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Work from home

Experience:

* Customer relationship management: 2 years (Required)
* Client services: 5 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work Location: Remote

We’re a delightfully tiny, fully remote team that operates on five core values: rel

jobs.title: Service & Sales Representative (PVD) - Full-Time & Part-Time
jobs.description:
Check out a day in the life at CLEAR in the video above.

  

**Job Overview:**

As a **CLEAR Sales and Service Representative (Ambassador)**, you will be the face of CLEAR, responsible for driving membership growth while delivering exceptional customer service. Your main focus will be to engage with travelers, explain the benefits of CLEAR’s services, and convert potential customers into loyal members. In this sales & service focused role, you will work in a fast-paced environment where your energy, communication skills, and drive for success will help you consistently exceed sales targets, all while providing a great experience for our members.

**What You'll Do:**

**Sales and Customer Engagement as an Ambassador for CLEAR:**

* **Drive Membership Sales:** Actively engage with travelers, pitch the benefits of CLEAR, and convert interactions into membership enrollments.
* **Deliver Exceptional Customer Service:** Create positive and memorable experiences for travelers, members, and potential customers by providing top-tier service and addressing any inquiries.
* **Security and Safety Adherence:** Follow all security protocols, including verifying airline documents, confirming traveler identification, and maintaining strict adherence to safety procedures.
* **Achieve and Exceed Sales Goals:** Meet or exceed daily and monthly sales targets by consistently enrolling new members through proactive engagement and effective sales techniques.
* **Demonstrate adaptability** in learning and selling a variety of products and services, with the ability to quickly pivot between offerings based on customer needs and operational priorities.

**What You're Great At:**

* **Sales-Focused:** Passion for sales with a results-driven mindset, always looking to meet and exceed targets. Prior experience in sales or customer service is a plus, but we will provide the training to help you succeed!
* **Strong Communicator:** Ability to effectively communicate the value of CLEAR’s offerings and engage with potential customers, members, and travelers.
* **Customer-Centric:** Skilled at creating meaningful connections with customers and offering tailored solutions to their travel needs.
* **Self-Motivated:** Energetic, positive attitude with a desire to grow and take on additional responsibilities, particularly in sales.

**Role Requirements:**

* Must be 18 years of age or older.
* High school diploma or GED equivalent required.
* Open availability and flexibility – ability to work various shifts including weekends and holidays.
* Ability to stand for up to 8 hours per day.
* Completion of airport badging and government screening process, including a drug test.

**About CLEAR**

Have you ever had that green-light feeling? That feeling when you hit every green light and the day just feels like magic? CLEAR’s mission is to create frictionless experiences where every day has that feeling. With more than 27+ million passionate members and hundreds of partners around the world, CLEAR’s identity platform is transforming the way people live, work, and travel. Whether it’s at the airport, stadium, or right on your phone, CLEAR connects you to the things that make you, you - unlocking easier, more secure, and more seamless experiences - making them all feel like magic.

jobs.title: FRACTIONAL DIGITAL MARKETING OFFICER
jobs.description:
FRACTIONAL DIGITAL MARKETING OFFICER (FMO)
  
Investment Sales – Commercial Brokerage
  
**Position Type:** Fractional / Contract (with option for full\-time)
  
**Location:** Dallas–Fort Worth (Hybrid or Remote \+ Periodic Onsite)
  
**Reports To:** Managing Partner / Head of Investment Sales
  
Role Overview
  
The Fractional Marketing Officer (FMO) is a senior marketing executive responsible for
  
building, managing, and scaling the marketing engine of a high\-performance investment\-
  
sales commercial brokerage. This role drives brand strategy, lead generation, deal
  
marketing, investor communications, and agent enablement to increase listings, pipeline
  
velocity, and brokerage revenue.
  
The FMO supports the full lifecycle of investment\-sales assignments—from prospecting to
  
listing launch to contract to close—while elevating the brokerage’s market authority and
  
digital footprint.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
1\. repositioning firm from an outbound sales strategy to an inbound sales strategy.
  
2\. Automate and build AI into lead scoring through enriched market and client
  
intelligence revamping/refining or implementing a new CRM platform.
  
Oversee listing launch workflows and syndication (Crexi, LoopNet/Costar, internal investor
  
lists).
  
Ensure materials reflect accurate underwriting data, compelling visuals, and investment
  
rationale.
  
3\. Lead Generation \& Pipeline Growth
  
Build and execute digital lead\-gen campaigns targeting property owners and investors.
  
Implement nurture sequences, remarketing campaigns, and database growth strategies.
  
Establish lead scoring systems to prioritize high\-value prospects.
  
Manage PPC, SEO, email automation, and top\-of\-funnel pipeline acceleration.
  
4\. Marketing Operations \& Technology
  
Oversee CRM and marketing automation systems (HubSpot, Salesforce, Podio, Zoho,
  
SharpLaunch, Mailchimp, Zapier, AI agents).
  
outreach.
  
Required Qualifications
  
7–15\+ years of experience in marketing, preferably in commercial real estate, investment
  
banking, private equity, or other B2B professional services.
  
Deep understanding of CRE investment\-sales workflows and deal lifecycles.
  
Expertise in digital marketing, CRM systems, automation workflows, and data\-driven
  
campaign management.
  
Strong writing, content strategy, and investment storytelling skills.
  
Ability to independently manage projects, prioritize deliverables, and operate in a fast\-
  
paced brokerage environment.
  
Preferred Qualifications
  
Experience marketing multifamily, retail NNN, office, land, or value\-add assets.
  
Familiarity with Crexi, Costar/LoopNet, Reonomy, Yardi, ResMan, and SharpLaunch.
  
Prior fractional leadership or high\-growth brokerage experience.
  
Strong design sensibility for investment\-grade marketing collateral.
  
Engagement Structure (Fractional)
  
10–30 hours per week depending on listing load and strategic priorities.
  
Monthly retainer with optional performance\-based bonuses tied to:
  
Closed deals
  
Listing wins
  
Lead\-generation KPIs
  
Option to scale to full\-time as brokerage grows.
  
Full\-Time Compensation Range (DFW Market)
  
For a full\-time equivalent Chief Marketing Officer / Director\-level hybrid in an investment\-
  
sales brokerage environment, the typical Dallas–Fort Worth compensation range is:
  
  

**Base Salary (DFW):**  

$135,000 – $185,000 annually
  
(Depending on seniority, CRE experience, and leadership scope)
  
  

**Bonus Structure:****Additional 15% – 40% of base tied to performance metrics:**  

New listing acquisition
  
Deal marketing performance
  
Lead\-gen growth
  
Closed\-deal volume
  
Firm revenue growth
  
  

**Total Comp Potential:**  

$160,000 – $250,000\+ annually, depending on performance structure.
  
What Success Looks Like (6–12 Months)
  
Predictable monthly seller\-lead generation pipeline established.
  
Listing marketing quality elevated to top\-quartile CRE standards.
  
Brokerage brand recognized as a market authority.
  
Agent efficiency improved through automation and centralized resources.
  
Reduced time\-to\-market for all deals.
  
Higher conversion of valuations listings executed purchase agreements.

jobs.title: Service & Sales Representative (OAK) - Full-Time & Part-Time
jobs.description:
Check out a day in the life at CLEAR in the video above.

**Job Overview:**

As a **CLEAR Sales and Service Representative (Ambassador)**, you will be the face of CLEAR, responsible for driving membership growth while delivering exceptional customer service. Your main focus will be to engage with travelers, explain the benefits of CLEAR’s services, and convert potential customers into loyal members. In this sales & service focused role, you will work in a fast-paced environment where your energy, communication skills, and drive for success will help you consistently exceed sales targets, all while providing a great experience for our members.

**What You'll Do:**

**Sales and Customer Engagement as an Ambassador for CLEAR:**

* **Drive Membership Sales:** Actively engage with travelers, pitch the benefits of CLEAR, and convert interactions into membership enrollments.
* **Deliver Exceptional Customer Service:** Create positive and memorable experiences for travelers, members, and potential customers by providing top-tier service and addressing any inquiries.
* **Security and Safety Adherence:** Follow all security protocols, including verifying airline documents, confirming traveler identification, and maintaining strict adherence to safety procedures.
* **Achieve and Exceed Sales Goals:** Meet or exceed daily and monthly sales targets by consistently enrolling new members through proactive engagement and effective sales techniques.
* **Demonstrate adaptability** in learning and selling a variety of products and services, with the ability to quickly pivot between offerings based on customer needs and operational priorities.

**What You're Great At:**

* **Sales-Focused:** Passion for sales with a results-driven mindset, always looking to meet and exceed targets. Prior experience in sales or customer service is a plus, but we will provide the training to help you succeed!
* **Strong Communicator:** Ability to effectively communicate the value of CLEAR’s offerings and engage with potential customers, members, and travelers.
* **Customer-Centric:** Skilled at creating meaningful connections with customers and offering tailored solutions to their travel needs.
* **Self-Motivated:** Energetic, positive attitude with a desire to grow and take on additional responsibilities, particularly in sales.

**Role Requirements:**

* Must be 18 years of age or older.
* High school diploma or GED equivalent required.
* Open availability and flexibility – ability to work various shifts including weekends and holidays.
* Ability to stand for up to 8 hours per day.
* Completion of airport badging and government screening process, including a drug test.

**About CLEAR**

Have you ever had that green-light feeling? That feeling when you hit every green light and the day just feels like magic? CLEAR’s mission is to create frictionless experiences where every day has that feeling. With more than 27+ million passionate members and hundreds of partners around the world, CLEAR’s identity platform is transforming the way people live, work, and travel. Whether it’s at the airport, stadium, or right on your phone, CLEAR connects you to the things that make you, you - unlocking easier, more secure, and more seamless experiences - making them all feel like magic.

*CLEAR is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. CLEAR will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of any applicable laws or ordinance. CLEAR also provides accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or in other covered statuses. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at fieldrecruiting@clearme.com.*

jobs.title: Fractional CFO _ Emerging Technologies Practice
jobs.description:
### **Description**

 **What does it mean to be a Fractional CFO within the Escalon team?**
As a fractional CFO you could spend a few hours a month up to full time availably applying your technical and account management skill set across a variety of clients and industries.  

**What You’ll Do:**

The primary objective of the Fractional CFO within our Emerging Technologies Practice is to oversee enterprise accounting and provide financial information about client company’s activities that will assist the client and its shareholders in making economic company decisions. This position is proactive and solution oriented, offering depth of experience to our clients in the fast\-paced world of start\-up accounting.

This position will afford you a high degree of flexibility, the ability to focus on CFO\-level work (with a US and global team who will handle the bookkeeping and transactional accounting), an opportunity to work with exciting companies, and a support network of experienced financial professionals.

We are looking for stellar CFOs who have the experience, skills and desire to support a diverse and intriguing mix of businesses while building and managing strong client relationships. If you are ready to work with cutting\-edge startup companies, founders, investors and stakeholders focused on results, this opportunity is designed for you.  

**Day\-to\-Day Responsibilities also include:*** Primary responsibility and ownership for overall engagement level relationship with the client
* Provide insightful and trusted counsel to client business leadership and internal engagement team on both financial and broad\-based business issues related to the overall performance of the client company.
* Serve as a consulting member of the client leadership team in providing advice regarding the financial implications of all major client business decisions, as well as strategic input to shape client business objectives.
* Direct the work of accounting and financial planning team in all financial reporting including the provision of comprehensive monthly financial statements, and the development of forecasts and budgets respectively.
* Enable aligned direction and value creation through effective short and long\-range budgeting and forecasting
* Inform the client’s treasury function including optimizing cash flow
* Assist with strategies to capitalize the business, assisting to secure debt facilities and/or support fundraising activity.
* Identify opportunities for improvement, cost reduction, and systems enhancement.
* Manage external relationships with auditors and tax preparers and oversee risk management, including insurance.
* Oversee Corporate Governance and internal controls.
* Provide support on mergers and acquisitions and due diligence processes.
* Review and oversee client onboarding process to ensure company meets and exceeds client expectations.
* Create and nurture partnerships across functional roles within our organization including our OneShore team located in India

  

### **What You'll Bring**

  

**What You'll Bring**  

**Must Haves:*** 10\+ years in a financial role with 3\+ years as a CFO
* Active CPA
* **Token economics**. Strong understanding of and familiarity with token supply, vesting, staking rewards, inflation/deflation mechanics, etc.
* **On\-chain accounting**. Comfort with blockchain explorers, wallet structures, smart contracts, and reconciling on\-chain activity with off\-chain systems and financial statements. Experience with popular accounting subledgers a major plus.
* **Regulatory environment**. Experience operating in the ever\-evolving regulatory environment (SEC, CFTC, etc.), assessing risk around token classification, custody, revenue recognition, and disclosures.
* **Treasury management**. Some expertise in managing crypto and fiat treasuries, liquidity planning, and custody/security \- e.g., multi\-sig, key management.
* **Tax**. Knowledge of crypto\-specific tax issues (airdrop income, staking rewards, token swaps, etc.) and how they affect reporting and strategy.
* **Capital formation**. Familiarity with off\-shore entity formation, substance requirements, MSA/licensing structures, token launches, community allocations, DAO funding structures, etc.

### **More about us:**

  

Escalon Services is a Business Process Management (BPM) company that provides Essential Business Services (EBS) through a tech\-enabled platform to small\- and medium\-sized businesses (SMBs) and startups. The Company enables its clients to spend less time on "back office" functions and provides the value and insight that enables clients to spend more time focusing on delivering value and moving their businesses forward. With a US\-based remote workforce and global delivery team in India, Escalon’s solution fills a widening service gap in the SMB market, underpinned by (i) increasing demand for quality insights in an increasingly competitive marketplace (ii) decreasing supply of CPAs and quality in\-house talent and (iii) the cost frictions associated with scaling internal back\-office teams as businesses grow. For more information on Escalon: https://escalon.services/
Since founding, the company has executed both on an organic and M\&A strategy to expand service offerings and drive revenue expansion opportunity through cross\-sell/up\-sell. Before partnering with New Harbor Capital in late 2022, Escalon completed two significant acquisitions which tripled the revenue of the company and expanded the FinOps capabilities of the platform. Continued corporate development is a key value driver for the business going forward, with a highly fragmented market of service providers, often individually unable to scale due to lack of technology\-enablement and offshore capabilities.
In late 2022, New Harbor Capital made a growth equity investment in Escalon Services.  


About New Harbor Capital
New Harbor Capital is an experienced, lower middle\-market private equity firm that seeks to partner with growth\-minded, founder\-owned companies. Based out of Chicago, New Harbor Capital is committed to optimizing the growth potential of its portfolio companies while respecting their long\-term visions. The firm was founded on the belief that mutual respect and collaboration lead to successful outcomes. New Harbor recognizes the importance of finding the right partner, and the firm is committed to helping its portfolio companies and their leadership maximize both personal and financial goals.  


As a strategic partner, New Harbor taps into decades of experience to guide businesses through challenging economic cycles and market conditions. New Harbor Capital has raised over $750M in capital across three funds and focuses on tech\-enabled services, healthcare, and education services.### **About Escalon Services, LLC.**

jobs.title: Vice President of Sales- Therapy Contract Management
jobs.description:
**Vice President of Sales – Therapy Contract Management**

**Location:** Remote (U.S.) — Travel Required  
**Job Type:** Full-Time | Executive Leadership  
**Industry:** Skilled Nursing & Post-Acute Care

**Company Overview**

We are a rapidly growing contract management organization specializing in therapy service delivery within skilled nursing facilities. We help SNFs strengthen clinical outcomes, regulatory compliance, and financial performance through strategic therapy contract oversight and operational support.As we continue to expand our national footprint, we are seeking an experienced and driven **VP of Sales** to lead business development and drive continued growth.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and execute a nationwide sales strategy focused on therapy contract management within the SNF market
* Identify, pursue, and close new business with skilled nursing operators and post-acute care networks
* Engage decision-makers including CEOs, Regional Leaders, NHAs, and DORs
* Lead contract negotiations and proposal development with a consultative sales approach
* Analyze reimbursement trends and articulate value under PDPM payment models
* Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and trade associations
* Track performance metrics, forecast pipeline results, and report progress to executive leadership
* Work collaboratively across departments to ensure sustainable implementation and client success

**Qualifications**

* 7+ years of business development or executive sales experience in skilled nursing, therapy services, or healthcare contract management
* Strong understanding of SNF operations, PDPM, and regulatory/compliance factors affecting therapy delivery
* Proven track record of meeting or exceeding high-value sales targets
* Existing SNF decision-maker network strongly preferred
* Outstanding communication, negotiation, and executive-level presentation skills
* Self-motivated, strategic thinker with the ability to work autonomously
* Ability to travel regionally/nationally as needed

**Compensation & Benefits**

* Competitive executive base salary
* Lucrative bonus/incentive plan
* Paid time off + holidays
* Professional growth with a high-impact leadership role
* Supportive, collaborative culture

**Why Join Us?**

You’ll play a central role in shaping the future of a fast-growing organization — making a direct impact on both operational success and the quality of patient care across skilled nursing communities.

**How to Apply**

Submit your resume directly through Indeed. We look forward to speaking with you!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $160,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Paid time off

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience in healthcare sales?
* Do you have experience negotiating therapy contracts?

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Revenue Officer (CRO)
jobs.description:
**About Plutus Health Inc.:**  
Plutus Health Inc. is a leading provider of Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) services with SOC2 Certification. We are dedicated to helping healthcare providers improve their financial performance. Our expertise spans across various specialties. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients. As a result, **Plutus Health Inc. has been recognized on the 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America and ranked 100 in the Dallas area. Additionally, the company has been a 2024 finalist in the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year.**

Position Overview:
  
The Fractional Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) will be responsible for overseeing all revenue-generating activities within Plutus Health Inc. This C-suite executive will develop and implement strategies to increase sales, expand market presence, and maximize revenue opportunities. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in driving revenue growth within the healthcare or RCM industry.  
  
Key Responsibilities:  
  
1. Revenue Growth Strategy:  

* Develop and execute comprehensive revenue generation strategies that align with the company’s overall goals.
* Identify new market opportunities and lead initiatives to capture additional market share.
* Drive sales growth through effective sales strategies, partnerships, and business development activities.

  
2. Sales Leadership:  

* Lead, mentor, and develop the sales team to achieve and exceed revenue targets.
* Establish and monitor sales performance metrics, ensuring accountability and continuous improvement.
* Foster a high-performance sales culture focused on customer satisfaction and revenue growth.

  
3. Market Expansion:  

* Identify and evaluate new market segments and customer needs.
* Develop and implement strategies to enter new markets and expand the company’s footprint.
* Collaborate with marketing to create targeted campaigns that drive demand and brand awareness.

  
4. Client Relationship Management:  

* Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients and partners.
* Ensure high levels of client satisfaction and retention.
* Develop strategies to upsell and cross-sell services to existing clients.

  
5. Revenue Operations:  

* Oversee the development and implementation of pricing strategies.
* Collaborate with finance to forecast revenue, set targets, and monitor performance against goals.
* Ensure the alignment of sales, marketing, and operations to drive revenue growth.

  
6. Data-Driven Decision Making:  

* Utilize data analytics to inform strategic decisions and optimize revenue-generating activities.
* Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to stay ahead of the curve.
* Provide regular reports and updates to the executive team on revenue performance and opportunities.

  
Qualifications:  
  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in revenue generation roles, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership position.
* Proven track record of driving revenue growth in the healthcare or RCM industry.
* Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire high-performing sales teams.
* Proficiency in CRM software and data analytics tools.

  
Why Plutus Health Inc.:  
  

* Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team.
* Play a key role in shaping the revenue strategy of a growing company.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.

jobs.title: Software Engineer- Domain Expert Lead (Contract), AGI - Data Services
Software Engineer- Domain Expert Lead (Contract), AGI - Data Services
Principal PDM, Advisory Partners, BCAP
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------

This position is part of the AWS Specialist and Partner Organization (ASP). Specialists own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy for their respective technology domains, providing the business and technical expertise to help our customers succeed. Partner teams own the strategy, recruiting, development, and growth of our key technology and consulting partners. Together they provide our customers with the expertise and scale needed to build innovative solutions for their most complex challenges.  
  
The AWS Business Consulting and Advisory Partners Org (BCAP) works with major advisory/management consulting firms to bring cloud computing to enterprises around the globe.
  
  
AWS is the worlds most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform offering over 200 fully featured services from data centers globally. Millions of customers -including the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies - are using AWS to lower costs, become more agile, and innovate faster.
  
  
As a Principal PDM, you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of Amazon’s cloud computing platform within the strategic advisory community and their clients.  
  
  
  
  
Key job responsibilities  
Your responsibilities will include developing deep business, strategic, and technical relationships with your assigned Advisory/Management Consulting firms and their client base. You will work to identify areas where AWS and your assigned Advisory/Management Consulting firm partner can jointly unlock significant business potential. You will work closely with the AWS Sales team to drive the day-to-day interactions with our partners and enterprise customers in order to create long-term business opportunities. You’ll work closely with AWS Sales, AWS Solution Architects and your assigned Advisory/Management Consulting firm partners to identify and conceptualize innovative industry specific solutions that drive transformational change for the industry. Finally, you will leverage your relationships and experience within the C-Suite to become a trusted advisor to your external and internal partners driving innovation, business outcomes, and industry transformation with marquee enterprise customers.  
  
Your business background will enable you to drive engagement at the CxO/VP level. Your technology experience will enable you to easily interact with our solution architects and professional service teams. Your strategic thinking skills, business analytics skills, and technology experience will provide the ability to develop and convey compelling value propositions and build consensus across the organization.
  
  
About the team  
The BCAP team operates as a global team, sharing insights and experiences from our engagements at a global, regional and local level. Our BCAP tenets are:  
1. Business Impact: Our engagements with the BCAPs focus on delivering measurable business impact for large Commercial and Public Sector customers.  
2. Top Management Focus: BCAP engagements ensure AWS goes beyond the CIO to engage the Board, CEO, and LOB executives, focused on achieving the customer’s business priorities.  
3. Trusted, discreet advisors: The BCAP model relies on earning and maintaining trust, operating transparently, while protecting the confidence of our customers and their BCAP relationships.  
  
candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  
  
Why AWS  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  
  
Work/Life Balance  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  
  
Inclusive Team Culture  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  
  
Mentorship and Career Growth  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 10+ years of business development, strategic partnerships, or client management experience; or
* 10+ years experience working for or working in concert with the top-tier Advisory/ Management Consulting community; and
* 5+ years of experience in the technology industry

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Experience with alliances or partnerships
* Business enablement experience in Cloud Computing with respect to how companies are leveraging these capabilities to drive business outcomes and the challenges they face in achieving them.
* Experience with account management, relationship management and solution selling
* Industry experience in Auto, Manufacturing, Healthcare/Life Sciences, or Financial Services
* MBA or equivalent degree

  
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Principal Delivery Consultant, Advisory
jobs.description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------

The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a Principal Advisory Consultant to shape and transform how enterprises leverage cloud technology. This strategic role will influence leaders across industries, market segments, and technical domains to drive transformative business outcomes. As a Principal-level advisor, you will be responsible for identifying patterns across customers, developing new architectural patterns, and creating innovative capabilities that define the future of cloud adoption.  
  
Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Principal Delivery Consultant you will drive innovation and influence executive-level stakeholders across multiple organizations. You’ll work closely with stakeholders as trusted advisors providing guidance on industry trends, enterprise cloud transformation, and innovative cloud solutions. You will be responsible sales support, ensuring alignment to customer business outcomes and value realization.  
  
The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.  
  
Key job responsibilities  
As a Principal Advisory Consultant, you will:  
1. Drive significantly complex technical initiatives and strategic business transformations across industries and market segments  
2. Lead the creation and delivery of novel technical services, capabilities, or industry-level solutions used globally  
3. Identify patterns across customers and develop new architectural patterns and design principles that become industry standards  
4. Cultivate strategic relationships with senior leaders and serve as a trusted advisor on transformative initiatives  
5. Drive strategic sales opportunities from inception to closure at the executive level  
6. Create scalable mechanisms and lead new initiatives that transform how customers adopt cloud technologies  
8. Provide widely recognized thought leadership through industry presentations and executive engagements  
9. Mentor and develop leaders while growing a culture of collaboration, empathy, and inclusion  
10. Balance risk and quality while creating mechanisms to address recurring escalation patterns  
  
A day in the life  
Advisory Team partners with our customers to increase their shareholder value and assist in disrupting their business models. We enable our customers to drive competitive advantage by enhancing their digital capabilities that will enable them to innovate on new products and services.  
  
Our key focus areas include: Cloud Strategy and Business Value Alignment (Enterprise Transformation), Cloud Operating Models & Governance, Cloud Migration Readiness and Planning, Organizational Change & Enablement, Data & AI Transformation  
  
About the team  
About AWS:  
Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  
Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  
Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  
Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

1. 8+ years experience in cloud architecture and implementation
  
2. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field; Master's degree preferred  
3. 10+ years experience in enterprise cloud transformation initiatives involving C-suite executives with at least 5 enterprise cloud transformation initiatives from the following industries: GameTech, Regulated Gaming, Telco, Financial Services, Manufacturing, Energy, or Retail/CPG  
4. 10+ years experience implementing at least 3 technology solutions in one or more of the following domains that delivered minimum 15% cost reduction or $1M+ annual revenue growth: Cloud Strategy and Business Value Alignment, Enterprise Transformation, Cloud Operating Models & Governance, Data & AI Transformation  
5. Led a minimum of 3 cross-functional teams of 10+ members each, managing complex programs spanning at least 2 distinct organizations per program, within the past 5 years

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Strong understanding of multiple industry verticals and their specific cloud adoption challenges
* AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., AWS Certified AI Practitioner, Machine Learning, Solutions Architect)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Deep expertise in emerging technologies such as Generative AI, Agentic AI, and their enterprise applications
* Strong communication ability to create and deliver compelling technical and business presentations to VP and C-level audiences
* Write effective narratives and present them to leadership across teams

  
Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  
  
Los Angeles County applicants: Job duties for this position include: work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff; adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions; communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service; and follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness and professionalism, and safeguard business operations and the Company’s reputation. Pursuant to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  
  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

The base salary range for this position is listed below. Your Amazon package will include sign-on payments and restricted stock units (RSUs). Final compensation will be determined based on factors including experience, qualifications, and location. Amazon also offers comprehensive benefits including health insurance (medical, dental, vision, prescription, Basic Life & AD&D insurance and option for Supplemental life plans, EAP, Mental Health Support, Medical Advice Line, Flexible Spending Accounts, Adoption and Surrogacy Reimbursement coverage), 401(k) matching, paid time off, and parental leave. Learn more about our benefits at https://amazon.jobs/en/benefits.
